title: Lead Analyst - Power App and Automate
description:
**Job Title:** Lead Analyst – Power Apps and Automate (Onsite – Richmond, VA)  
**Location:** Richmond, VA (Onsite – 3 Days/Week)  
**Employment Type:** Contract  
**Interview Type:** **Web Cam and In-Person Only**

**Position Overview**

We are seeking a **Lead Analyst – Power Apps and Automate** for an onsite contract opportunity with the **client**. This hands-on leadership role requires **expert-level proficiency** in Microsoft Power Platform, especially Power Apps and Power Automate.

The ideal candidate will split time between technical solution development (70%) and leading a small team of analysts (30%). This role will be based **onsite in Richmond, VA, 3 days per week**, and requires candidates to reside **within a 2-hour commuting distance**.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Technical (70%)**

* Design, develop, and enhance **Power Apps** to streamline business workflows.
* Build and maintain **Power Automate flows**, integrating automation across departments.
* Support Tier 1 and Tier 2 applications using standard and premium connectors.
* Maintain **Power BI dashboards** for reporting and analytics.
* Troubleshoot support tickets related to Power Platform and ensure performance optimization.
* Ensure solutions adhere to security and scalability best practices.

**Leadership (30%)**

* Lead a team of analysts, providing mentorship and technical oversight.
* Promote **Power Platform best practices** across all projects.
* Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders to align technical solutions with strategic goals.
* Present insights, progress reports, and solution recommendations to leadership.

**Required Skills & Qualifications**

* **7+ years** of experience in business analysis, automation, or Power Platform development.
* Advanced hands-on experience in **Power Apps**, **Power Automate**, and **Canvas Apps**.
* Strong understanding of **Azure integrations** and **Power BI dashboards**.
* Experience in managing **application lifecycle**, automation monitoring, and cloud-based solutions.
* Ability to lead and mentor a team while remaining technically engaged.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Microsoft certifications in **Power Platform**, **Azure**, or relevant technologies.
* Familiarity with **Application Performance Monitoring (APM)** tools for Power Platform.

**Soft Skills**

* Strong decision-making and process-improvement orientation.
* Diplomatic conflict resolution and negotiation abilities.
* Experience collaborating with business units to assess complex processes.

**Pre-Screen Questions (Required Responses):**

* Do you confirm that the candidate will physically reside within the United States throughout the assignment?
* Please provide the candidate’s email address.
* Can the candidate **work onsite in Richmond, VA 3 days per week**

**How to Apply**  
Submit your **updated resume**, **rate expectations**, and answers to the pre-screen questions to: careers@collaboratingtechs.com

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Work Location: In person

title: Software Business Systems Analyst
description:
Sol-Ark is a Veteran-owned solar and battery-based technology manufacturer based in Texas. Our mission is making the most reliable, innovative, and affordable solar storage solutions to power families & their businesses. Founded in 2013, the company has experienced massive, organic growth due to our equipment being 3x more powerful and capable than best-in-class alternatives. It is a fast-paced, yet casual work environment. We are a close-knit team looking to make significant contributions to a very fast-growing industry that values merit, character, aptitude, sustainability and self-reliance.

**Please use this link to apply:** https://zurl.to/vmsZ?source=CareerSite

**Location:** This position will be on-site at our corporate offices in Allen, Texas (Dallas-Fort Worth area).  
  
**Not a remote position.**  
  
Full-time W-2 ONSITE opportunity (not remote)!  
  
**Work Eligibility:**

* Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without requiring employer-sponsored visa sponsorship now or in the future.
* At this time, we are unable to consider candidates on F1-OPT status.

We are seeking an experienced Software Business Systems Analyst with 7+ years of professional experience, specifically focused on creating detailed technical requirements /user stories for custom Java/JEE/Spring software for the cloud systems using agile requirements standards. The role requires inputs from Product Marketing, Sales and other business units and translates them into technical requirements that the technical team can develop. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical software background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a proven track record of delivering high-quality software requirements.  
  
**Responsibilities:**

* Translate high-level product requirements from MRD and PRD into technical requirements/user stories for the development teams to develop software.
* Develop user stories for UI, API, database, and other software systems and applications with input from product owner and development leads.
* Interface and participate in initial customer technical discussions to better evaluate project scope and tasks.
* Work with project manager/program office to keep all user stories, developer tasks updated and current based on the project changes and modifications for every sprint.
* Work with firmware teams to create requirements for software systems and applications.
* Work with an infrastructure team to create requirements for AWS Cloud.
* Work with vendors to help resolve bugs, issues, and technical debt.

**Software Support and Maintenance:**

* Collaborate with software developers, FW, QA, and infrastructure teams to help troubleshoot specific issues/bugs for software applications.
* Work with IT Support, vendors and various business teams to manage bug fix support by triaging, assessing for probable causes and impact.
* Provide support to software engineers by sharing necessary application domain knowledge that will help them fix the bugs promptly.

**Project Management Support:**

* Work with Product and business groups to correctly assess and prioritize bugs, by educating them of the level of impact and complexity involved.
* Works with development leads and product owner to identify workload for the team up to 2 months in advance.

**Requirements:**

* Work on JIRA Atlassian board to create user stories, epic, initiatives etc.
* Ability to write SQL queries to do data analysis for business problems to draw insights.
* Working knowledge of APIs, ability to write basic clients to APIs to test and instrument them for performance.
* Ability to create business process workflows for the end users.
* Experience using scripts and scripting languages e.g. Python, YAML, etc.
* Familiarity with writing requirements for Cloud monitoring, metrics and analytics i.e. dashboards using Grafana or similar tools.
* Excellent communication skills both vertically and horizontally within the organization related to all aspects of technical leadership – written and verbal.

**Salary and Benefits:** We offer a competitive salary and performance-based bonus program, top-tier benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k), and paid time off.  
  
**Work Eligibility:**  
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without requiring employer-sponsored visa sponsorship now or in the future. At this time, we are unable to consider candidates on F1-OPT status.  
  
**Please use this link to apply:** https://zurl.to/vmsZ?source=CareerSite

title: General Manager
description:
**Job Title:** General Manager

**Reports To:** Board of Directors

**FLSA Status:** Exempt

**ACA Status (PT or FT):** FT

**Summary:** The General Manager is the chief executive officer responsible for implementing board policies and for managing the Meridian Service Metropolitan District and, by agreement, for managing the Meridian Ranch Metropolitan District, and Meridian Ranch 2018 Subdistrict, all Title 32 Special Districts, working under the direction of the MSMD Board of Directors as further described below.

The General Manager executes delegated administrative, financial and operational policies for the District involving all District services including: water, wastewater and surface water management; recreation centers and services, community parks, trails, landscaped parkways; and the Antler Creek Golf Course non-potable irrigation water supply. The General Manager is the appointing authority for all District employees and directly supervises District division managers. The General Manager coordinates with legal counsel, oversees all contracts and intergovernmental agreements, and serves as the primary contact with outside parties including the media, and any other duties/responsibilities as directed by the Board. The General Manager position is a full-time, salaried, position, and is considered exempt under the Fair Labor Standards Act.

**The District:** The Meridian Service Metropolitan District (MSMD) is responsible for owning, operating, and maintaining water, wastewater and storm drainage systems, community parks, recreation centers, street lights, and substantial landscaping for the master planned community of Meridian Ranch consisting of 2,560 acres and a planned 5,000 residential units. The Meridian Ranch community currently includes one elementary school, one high school, the Antler Creek golf course and The Shops at Meridian Ranch retail center, all commercial customers of the District.

The water system has multiple sources of supply including on-site and off-site Denver Basin and alluvial groundwater, two raw water booster pump stations, a Water Treatment Plant, 3 storage tanks, a potable water booster pump station, and extensive distribution system. The District has multiple intergovernmental agreements with other districts regarding the delivery and supply of water including emergency supplies and potential replacement water pursuant to a joint Replacement Plan with the Cherokee Metropolitan District.

The wastewater system includes a collection system, and a major lift station and force main which pump wastewater to a regional facility known as the Black Squirrel Waste Water Reclamation Facility owned and operated by the Cherokee Metropolitan Service District. The District has multiple intergovernmental agreements with other districts regarding the delivery and treatment of wastewater.

The parks and recreation system includes a 42,000 square foot recreation center including indoor swimming pool, outdoor swimming pool, workout facilities, and gym. A second recreation facility, a 45,600 square foot field house with an indoor turf field, an indoor track, and workout spaces, is scheduled to be completed in 2025.

The District owns and operates Community Parks, and miles of landscaped trails and streetscape.

The District administrative staff is currently located in leased office space at The Shops at Meridian Ranch. The District plans to construct a new office building near the new Field House scheduled to be completed in 2025. The primary developer within the District is GTL Development Inc. The General Manager works closely with GTL throughout the buildout period of Meridian Ranch, planning for the transition from a developing master planned community to a completed community.

**Specific Duties and Responsibilities of the General Manager** include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

* Responsible for the success of all District functions. Develop and implement delegated administrative, financial, and operational policies for the District involving; water and wastewater service, community parks, street lights, and the Meridian Ranch Recreation Center and Field House.
* Prepares proposed annual budgets for Board approval. Supervises District spending within approved budgets and provides thorough, accurate, and regular financial reports to the Board.
* Develops and manages capital improvement programs and projects.
* Develops and implements (with Board approval) personnel policies, Recreation Center operating policies, and other policies and procedures of the District.
* Works with other nearby districts and assists in negotiations with other districts and organizations to ensure the District’s interests are well-represented in intergovernmental agreements and other critical documents.
* Assists in preparing, negotiating, and reviewing contracts, leases, and Intergovernmental Agreements.
* Attends meetings and participates in organizations with which the District is associated.
* Coordinates with and directs legal counsel and other professional consultants (e.g., engineers, architects, financial advisors).
* Conducts interviews with media for public relations and other issues.

**Supervisory Responsibilities:** The General Manager is the appointing authority for all District employees and directly supervises District division managers. The District currently has approximately 110 employees. The staff is constantly growing due to the ongoing development of the master planned community and due to in-sourcing services that have been provided by contractors.

The General Manager carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. The General Manager also plans for the staffing levels and develops the organizational structure subject to Board approval.

**Qualifications:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must possess and maintain a valid Colorado Driver’s License.

**Language Ability:** Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, Board members, clients, customers, and the general public.

**Math Ability:** Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

**Reasoning Ability:** Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

**Computer Skills:** To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Outlook.

**Education/Experience:** Eight to ten years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. Specific experience is preferred in either general administration and public finance, or water and sewer operations and maintenance and regulatory compliance, or engineering program management related to public utility capital projects design and construction. Experience working in special districts in Colorado is preferred.

**Knowledge, Skills and Other Abilities:** Comprehensive knowledge of budgeting for multiple departments, local government revenue enhancement and funding strategies and comprehensive accounting skills.

**Other Knowledge, Skills and Other Abilities:**

* Ability to be innovative and diplomatic in managerial approaches to problem-solving and team-building
* Ability to guide the district’s long-term vision with respect to staffing, services, capital improvements, and financial planning
* Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to communicate in a positive and friendly manner with coworkers and the public
* Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with regional partners, the business community, and land developers
* Understanding and commitment to ensuring regulatory compliance of all district facilities
* Demonstrates skill in successful multi-disciplinary project management
* Understands a wide variety of environmental issues, programs, and regulations
* Organizational skills
* Planning skills
* Basic understanding of SCADA and SCADA functions
* Significant working knowledge of water and wastewater facilities and operations
* Knowledge of and experience with local government revenue enhancement and funding strategies
* Basic understanding of Colorado water law (preferably Denver Basin and Designated Groundwater Basin Issues) and experience managing a portfolio of water rights
* Ability to be professional
* Time management skills
* Budget analysis skills
* Business analysis skills
* Market analysis skills
* Risk analysis skills
* Computer literate
* Keyboard skills

**Physical Demands:** The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, use hands, and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop kneel crouch or crawl, and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include ability to see color.

**Work Environment:** The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet or humid conditions, work near moving mechanical parts, work in high precarious places, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, outdoor weather conditions, risk of electrical shock, and vibration.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

**Equal Opportunity**

Meridian Service Metropolitan District is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply and join our team.

Application deadline: September 12th, 2025

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

title: Associate Business Systems Consultant, Salesforce (Hybrid)
description:
**Company Description**

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

 **Job Description**

Default point of contact for BTS with the business; brokers contracts between BTS and the business and resolves client and BTS relationship issues. Manages and provides expert advice on the selection, design, justification, implementation and business use of information systems. Analyzes business processes; elicits, analyzes, and documents business requirements; identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility and makes recommendations typically seeking to exploit and leverage new or existing technology components. Translates business requirements into functional requirements; performs data and process modeling; manages change; and leads, coordinates / performs testing, verification, and validation of requirements.

Responsibilities

* Elicits and communicates the organization’s business strategy; works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes and needs and opportunities for improvement; identifies IT capabilities and information required to support the business processes and collaborates in the development of appropriate information management strategies, developing them as an integrated part of the business strategy.
* Analyzing business needs and translating them into Salesforce solutions that optimize efficiency.
* Acting as a bridge between business stakeholders and the Salesforce system, ensuring effective communication and process improvements.
* Defining and managing technical requirements, leading user story creation, solution design, testing, and quality assurance.
* Tracking and managing project execution, ensuring progress, action items, and accountability.
* Driving process improvements, continuously optimizing Salesforce workflows for better business outcomes.
* Exercises latitude in determining objectives of assignment. Has defined authority and responsibility for a significant area of work, including technical, financial and quality aspects. Establishes organizational objectives and delegates assignments. Accountable for actions and decisions taken by self and subordinates.
* Accountable for the accuracy of the fit of the proposed solution to the business needs and the information upon which the business justification and prioritization decisions are made. Also accountable for communicating business need and drivers to development groups to assure the implementation phase can fulfill the business need.
* Proven ability to analyze business needs, identify process inefficiencies, and design scalable Salesforce solutions.
* Expertise in writing user stories, conducting user testing, and reviewing deliverables for quality assurance.
* Strong leadership and stakeholder management skills, ensuring cross-functional collaboration and accountability.
* Developing solutions with a data-driven approach and an outcome-oriented mindset, ensuring decisions are guided by insights and measurable impact
* Comfortable navigating high ambiguity and constant change, acting assertively yet respectfully.

**\\*\\*\\*This is a hybrid position that would require 4 days on-site at our Mettawa location.**

 **Qualifications**

*Required:*

* Bachelor’s Degree with 6 years’ experience; Master’s Degree with 5 years’ experience; PhD with 0 years’ experience.
* Salesforce Certified Administrator with 2+ years of hands-on experience.
* 5+ years of Business Analyst experience, working with Salesforce applications and enterprise digital transformations.
* Salesforce (Health Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Einstein, Agentforce) and platform configurations.
* SQL for basic querying and data analysis
* Project management frameworks (Agile, Jira, Confluence) to track deliverables effectively.
* Data visualization tools such as Power BI, Snowflake, MS Visio, Lucid chart for process mapping and analysis.
* Collaboration & communication tools for stakeholder engagement and team coordination.

*Beneficial:*

* Past Experience in Patient Support Programs or Patient Engagement

  
**Additional Information**

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:

* The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future.
* We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
* This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs.

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community. Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

title: Operations Data Analyst
description:
**Job Description**: Operations Data Analyst

**Position Description:**  
The Operations Data Analyst will work with large data sets related to customer orders, warehouse work orders and other transactional data required to support the Warehouse Operations team. The Operations Data Analyst must have intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills, great attention to detail, independent drive to adhere to organizational data quality standards and the ability to think critically to solve business problems with data analysis. Additionally, the ideal candidate has strong customer service skills. The Operations Data Analyst will work with an experienced Data Analyst and will support the Chief Development Officer, Chief Operating Officer and VP of Operations.

**Responsibilities:**  
Data Intake - adding customer and order data to the information repository  
Data Validation - Reviewing all incoming data, scrubbing duplicates or invalid values, flagging and reporting any data issues prior to data storage  
Data Transformation - Initially, leveraging pre-built data models and data transformation tools (such as Excel Power Query and Data Modeling Tools), to generate reports for the Operations team and to generate import files for the Warehouse Management System. Over time, the analyst should gain the skills to independently create new data models  
Process and Training - Creating and maintaining standard operating procedures and training materials related to data processing  
Continuous Improvement - always looking for ways to improve data quality and operational efficiency

**Required Skills, Experience and Education:**

Intermediate to Advanced Excel with strong understanding of how to apply formulas such as XLOOKUP and when to use Data Modeling tools and Macros  
Associate's in Information Systems, Computer Science or Business Administration  
  
**Preferred Skills:**  
Operations background  
Experience with Database Management Systems, Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence tools  
Experience with NetSuite WMS  
Experience with various CRM systems  
Experience with ETL tools  
Experience using Python and SQL  
Experience with various CRM systems

**Location:** Onsite - LaVergne, TN  
**Schedule:** Full Time (40 hours per week) - Monday - Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM  
**Compensation:** $65,000 - $75,000/year depending on experience.  
**Benefits:** Paid Time Off, Health Insurance and 401(k) matching

title: Business Analyst/PMO -- West Conshohocken, PA
description:
**Job Title: Senior Consultant – PMO / Business Analyst**  
**Location: West Conshohocken, PA (Hybrid – 3 days onsite per week)**  
**Duration: July 2025 – November 2026 (~16 months)**  
**Work Authorization: W2 only**  
**Experience Level: 5–10 Years**

**NO H1Bs**

**Overview:**  
Our client, a leading Management & Strategy Consulting firm, is seeking a **Senior Consultant (PMO / Business Analyst)** to support a large-scale, multi-year Back and Middle Office transformation initiative for a premier global investment bank. This role is onsite in the Greater Philadelphia area (West Conshohocken) and requires strong PMO, business analysis, and stakeholder management skills within the investment management domain.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Act as a PMO/BA lead supporting operational workstreams within a complex transformation program.
* Document current state processes, data flows, and technology architecture.
* Collaborate closely with business-side PMOs and operational leads to ensure alignment across initiatives.
* Create high-impact presentation materials and dashboards to support executive decision-making.
* Manage meeting logistics, action items, and cross-team communication.
* Contribute to project planning, tracking, and governance documentation.
* Drive clarity and structure in ambiguous environments and manage multiple priorities effectively.

**Ideal Candidate Profile:**

* 5–10 years of experience in a PMO and/or Business Analyst role.
* Prior exposure to private fund investing, ideally with fund of funds experience.
* Strong experience in documentation, stakeholder communication, and project coordination.
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite, including PowerPoint and Excel.
* Ability to navigate large, matrixed organizations and engage with diverse teams.

title: Sales Operations Specialist – B2B | Oil & Gas Equipment | CRM Analyst
description:
**Company Overview:**  
Jereh North American Group (NAG) is a leading oilfield equipment and energy solutions company with a global reputation for innovation, precision, and reliability. Our U.S. operations are expanding, and we're looking for top commercial talent to support and scale that growth.

**About the Role:**  
We are hiring a **Sales Management Senior Specialist** to join our growing Houston-based sales operations team. This role is NOT a frontline sales job — it's a **high-impact, commercial strategy role** responsible for analyzing sales data, maintaining CRM integrity, tracking opportunity pipelines, and supporting sales management with performance insights.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Track and analyze KPIs, sales funnel data, and sales performance metrics
* Support strategic account development and customer segmentation tracking
* Drive CRM data integrity, reporting accuracy, and opportunity tracking
* Monitor project opportunity dashboards and alert leaders of any delays or risks
* Develop internal SOPs for sales execution and support training rollouts
* Coordinate with the sales team to ensure smooth contract handoffs and process adherence

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
* 5+ years in B2B sales operations, CRM analysis, or sales strategy support
* Strong Excel and CRM proficiency (Salesforce or HubSpot required)
* Ability to collaborate across departments and communicate sales insights
* Must be willing to work **fully onsite** in our Houston office
* Oilfield Services (OFS) or Energy industry experience preferred
* Chinese bilingual is a plus, but not required

**What You'll Gain:**

* Direct visibility with leadership and sales executives
* Opportunity to shape and improve the commercial engine of a global company
* Fast-paced, collaborative culture focused on growth and innovation

**Apply Today:**  
If you are a **data-driven, CRM-proficient sales operations professional**, we want to hear from you. Apply now and help power Jereh’s next stage of commercial success.

* Dental insurance

* Paid time off

* Monday to Friday

title: TOPS - IDOT-Senior Business Analyst (MSF&W)
description:
**Job Title: Senior Business Analyst**

**Location: Hybrid – 2 days in Springfield 3 days remote**

**Agency: Illinois Department of Transportation (IDOT)**

**Project Name: Information System Contingency Plans (ISCP)**

**Duration: 2000 Each Role**

**No of FTE//'s: 1**

-

**Position Summary**

The Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting the full lifecycle of disaster recovery operations, including planning, coordination, execution, validation, and documentation across enterprise infrastructure and application portfolios. This role plays a key part in safeguarding business continuity by ensuring that disaster recovery processes are comprehensive, well-documented, regularly tested, and aligned with compliance, audit, and organizational standards.

The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of application and infrastructure architectures, coupled with the ability to document technical workflows and validate recovery procedures in a highly structured manner. Success in this role requires cross-functional collaboration, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate effectively across IT, compliance, and business continuity teams.

-

**Key Responsibilities**

1. Disaster Recovery Planning and Coordination

* Coordinate and manage disaster recovery test schedules and execution plans across diverse application and infrastructure teams.

* Ensure readiness of stakeholders by maintaining up-to-date test calendars, readiness checklists, resource allocation trackers, and stakeholder contact lists.

* Facilitate pre-test coordination meetings, communicate expectations, and ensure alignment of responsibilities across participating teams.

* Support the execution of tabletop exercises, failover simulations, and live DR tests in accordance with organizational continuity strategies.

2. Documentation Development and Maintenance

* Prepare, update, and maintain comprehensive recovery documentation, including:

o Application-specific recovery runbooks

o Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for disaster recovery and business continuity, including ISCP documentation

o Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO) documentation

o Communication, notification, and escalation procedures

* Review documentation for accuracy, completeness, and currency in collaboration with technical subject matter experts.

* Ensure all documentation complies with internal governance frameworks, audit requirements, and regulatory obligations.

3. Failover Testing and Recovery Validation

* Support the execution of disaster recovery and failover tests by monitoring test events, verifying procedures, and documenting outcomes.

* Validate system functionality, data integrity, and application performance within DR environments to ensure operational continuity can be maintained.

* Identify gaps or deviations from documented recovery procedures and facilitate root cause analysis in collaboration with IT teams.

* Track and document resolution of recovery issues and incorporate improvements into revised recovery plans and documentation.

4. Reporting and Executive Communication

* Develop structured and professional After-Action Reports (AARs) summarizing DR test objectives, activities, outcomes, and lessons learned.

* Create executive briefings and summaries for IT leadership, business continuity managers, and risk/compliance stakeholders.

* Maintain comprehensive audit trails and testing artifacts for regulatory review, ensuring all test evidence is captured and archived.

* Recommend procedural or documentation enhancements based on test findings and stakeholder feedback.

-

**Skills and Experience**

Required

* Solid understanding of enterprise IT architecture, including application components, databases, middleware, storage, and networking as they relate to disaster recovery.

* Demonstrated ability to document technical procedures and workflows, ensuring clarity and consistency across teams.

* Hands-on experience supporting DR or BCP test planning, coordination, and execution in large-scale environments.

* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Word (for documentation), Excel (for tracking and metrics), PowerPoint (for reporting), and Visio (for process mapping).

* Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with technical teams, project managers, and business stakeholders.

* Excellent organizational and analytical skills with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.

Preferred

* Knowledge of ServiceNow//'s APM module will be a plus but not mandatory.

* Experience with IT Service Management (ITSM) platforms and documentation repositories such as ServiceNow, SharePoint, or Confluence.

* Familiarity with disaster recovery and business continuity standards, such as ITIL, ISO 22301, or NIST SP 800-34.

* Knowledge of compliance requirements related to DR, such as SOC 2, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, or CJIS.

-

**Professional Attributes**

* Ability to work independently, manage time efficiently, and meet deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

* Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work across multiple departments to gather requirements, verify documentation, and support recovery testing.

* Commitment to process excellence and continuous improvement.

* Adaptability and composure during recovery events and high-pressure scenarios.

title: Oracle EBS R12 Supply Chain Planning IT BA
description:
We are looking for a senior experience Oracle EBS R12 business analyst with a background in supply chain planning, must have Oracle R12 MRP and/or ASCP experience.

**OVERVIEW:**

Sr. Oracle Business Analyst to lead the configuration, implementation, and support of Oracle applications for order management, manufacturing, and materials management. This role will bridge IT and business teams, translating needs into system solutions, driving process improvements, and ensuring seamless integration. Expertise in MRP analysis, inventory control, and manufacturing is essential, along with strong problem-solving, leadership, and technical skills to succeed in this dynamic position.

**JOB SUMMARY DESCRIPTION:**

This position is responsible for leading the suggestion, implementation and support of the Oracle business applications used to support order management, manufacturing, materials management, and related business functions. This position acts as a system and process consultant between internal business customers and IT.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES/RESULTS:**

* Lead the configuration/setup, testing, training, implementation, and support of Oracle application modules.
* Perform, document and manage application configuration setups, integration testing, end user training, and issue/defect tracking to closure.
* Lead the analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into system and process requirement specifications.
* Facilitate and document interviews, requirements workshops, site visits, use cases, scenarios, workflow analysis, modeling, and simulations in the analysis of current and future processes.
* Collaborate with functional areas of the business and IT to identify, evaluate and implement new applications, business processes and technologies to drive business performance improvements.
* Identify opportunities and work with business leaders to prioritize initiatives and enhancements to new and existing applications and business processes.
* Provide hands-on technical and functional end user support.
* Anticipate system issues, determine root cause of problems, develop solutions, and lead the effort to correct issues.
* Manage and drive project activities and serve as lead for simple to complex project tasks and/or work threads
* Lead cross-functional teams to implement new processes, systems, enhancements or upgrades.
* Other duties/responsibilities as assigned

**JOB REQUIREMENTS:**

**Minimum Education, Certification and Experience Requirements**

Education

* Four-year degree in Manufacturing/Industrial Engineering or Business Administration, or equivalent experience
* Experience
* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience as an Oracle Business Analyst gathering and tracking requirements
* 3-5 years of training skills desired
* 3-5 years of hands on experience with three or more of the following Oracle application modules: Order Management, Configurator, Bills of Material, Work in Process, Deport Repair, Install Base, Service Contracts, Inventory, Engineering, Purchasing, Advanced Supply Chain Planning, MRP, Quality, or CRM.

**Knowledge / Technical Requirement**

* Understanding of the order flow through a custom manufacturing environment.
* High degree of computer literacy required.
* General knowledge of PL/SQL preferred.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office products a must.
* Prior experience with Ad Hoc query tools desired, Oracle Discover preferred.
* Experience with relational databases a must.

**Competencies, Skills & Abilities**

* Ability and drive to achieve Results
* Strong customer focus
* Excellent problem-solving skills required
* Excellent troubleshooting/analytical skills required.
* Must have strong leadership and project management skills.
* Excellent self-management skills required.
* Excellent written, oral and interpersonal skills required.
* Strong leader and proven influencing talents across organizations
* Organized with attention to detail.
* Ability to work in fast paced environment
* Able to collaborate and function effectively in a team environment

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee stock purchase plan
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: HR Business Analyst
description:
Make a difference.

As a Business Analyst, you will conduct studies, prepare reports, and advise on feasibility, cost-effectiveness, strategic plans, proposals, special projects, and ongoing programs.

In this role you will:

* Consult with Corporate management and strategic planning committees to formulate strategic and tactical plans and directions
* Discuss overall intent of programs or projects, and determine broad guidelines for studies, utilizing knowledge of subject area, research techniques, and regulatory limitations
* Review and evaluate materials such as environmental impact statements, construction specifications, budget or staffing estimates, or sales and marketing reports to determine additional data requirements
* Conduct field investigations, economic surveys, demographic studies, or other appropriate research to gather required information
* Organize and analyze data from all sources, using statistical methods to ensure validity of results
* Evaluate information to determine feasibility of proposals or to identify factors requiring amendment
* Develop alternate plans for program or project incorporating recommendations for review of officials
* Maintain collection of socioeconomic, environmental, and regulatory data for use by planning and administrative personnel in government and private sectors
* Review plans and proposals submitted by other governmental planning commissions or private organizations to assist in formulation of overall strategic plans

What you bring to the table:

* Progressively responsible financial, sales, marketing, and/or operating experience; or related educational experience
* 4 year degree preferred: Strategy, Business, and/or Statistics
* Knowledge of electrical distribution, financial, marketing, sales, and service processes
* Organizational skills
* Presentation skills
* Interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to utilize all available resources to find, analyze, and report information upon which to develop plan
* Ability to work effectively with people at all levels of the organization
* Ability to statistically describe and analyze business financial, sales, and operating results
* Ability to perform trend analysis and recommend optimal course of action
* Ability to use software to collect, maintain, and analyze data

**Work Shift and Hours:**Monday - Friday, standard business hours, in office

**Compensation Details:**The expected base salary for this position is starting at $60,000 depending on experience. This position is also bonus eligible - based on specific and relevant business metrics.

**The** **Value of Graybar:**

At Graybar, we are known for our comprehensive benefits and our employee stock ownership plan! Most regular, full-time employees at Graybar may be eligible for a variety of benefits like:

* Multiple plan options for **Medical, Dental, Vision,** and **Prescription Drug** benefits.
* **Life Insurance** coverage for you and options for your family.
* Save on expenses with **Flexible Spending Accounts**.
* Enjoy our **Disability Benefits** at no cost to you.
* Share in our success with P**rofit Sharing Plans**.
* **401(k) Savings Plan** with company match to help secure your future.
* **Paid Vacation** & **Sick Days** to spend time away from work or in case of an illness.
* Rest and recharge during our **Paid Holidays** throughout the year.
* Take advantage of our **Paid Wellness Day** to focus on preventive care and prioritize your health.
* Volunteer with **Community Time Off** to give back to the community.
* **Predictable Work Schedules** to plan your life: no weekends or nights for most roles.
* Celebrate your and others' achievements with our **Employee Recognition Program**.
* Reach your career goals with our **Educational Reimbursement** and **Career Development Programs**.
* And **More Perks** that support your well-being and career growth.

Benefit eligibility may vary across locations and roles, so be sure to check in with your recruiter for more information.

**Why should you join Graybar?**

At Graybar, our employees are the heart and soul of our company. We believe that employees with diverse perspectives bring the ideas and innovative thinking we need to solve our biggest challenges and compete in an ever-changing world. Consistent with our values, we welcome people from all backgrounds, cultures and experiences into our company because we believe it’s the right thing to do and the right way to run our business.  
  
We want each of our employees to know that they matter and to feel a sense of belonging, ownership and inclusion at Graybar. We believe that everyone should be treated with dignity and respect, and we work to build a collaborative environment where our employees have the opportunity to grow, learn and make a difference, both as individuals and as part of the team.

That’s what our employee ownership culture is all about: working as one team and moving forward together, while honoring the unique value each person brings to our company.

**Apply now and find out what’s next for you.**

Equal Opportunity Employer/Vet/Disabled

***Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!***

title: Apple Pay - Strategy & Business Performance Analyst
description:
Help Apple Pay & Wallet deliver amazing new commerce experiences for Apple customers around the world. Apple Pay is a leading digital wallet for iOS customers in over 80 markets and growing rapidly, including e-commerce, transit, loyalty, and other product areas. We are looking for a Strategy & Business Performance Analyst to apply market data to derive insights on Apple Pay’s business performance, dissect the latest trends, and provide strategic recommendations on future product road map. Being an integral part of the multi-functional business teams, you will collaborate closely with product managers, data scientists, and business teams to identify underlying drivers of business performance, assess risks and opportunities, and provide performance updates to multi-functional and executive teams. Core responsibilities include business performance reporting and analysis, forecasting and modeling, and industry research. You will formulate actionable recommendations through your quantitative analysis, manage the financial performance of Apple Pay products, and communicate effectively across all levels of audience. This role will also focus on strategy for Apple Pay’s fast-evolving platform product portfolio. We, Apple Pay’s strategy team, develop unique perspectives on Apple Pay’s core businesses and ecosystem to help craft future product roadmaps. You will directly contribute to the development of new products through analysis such as market sizing and opportunity analysis. This is a high-impact role offering an outstanding opportunity to provide the business with critical view of its performance, drive and influence decisions impacting the immediate and long-term view of the business, and advise the leadership across Apple Pay teams globally.  
  
**Description**  
  
Analyze Apple Pay’s business performance and derive actionable insights on emerging drivers. Facilitate ongoing performance reporting across Apple Pay’s product portfolio. Establish and manage metric forecasts underpinning product performance. Assist annual and long-term business planning and forecasting. Prepare and deliver clear and insightful reports and analysis highlighting key trends, risks, and opportunities. Support product strategy analysis end-to-end, from financial sizing to ongoing tracking & reporting. Collaborate closely with product, analytics, business, and data science teams to deep dive into business performance and improve reporting dashboards on key operational metrics. Perform quantitative analysis including market research, pricing, competitive analysis, and financial modeling. Create benchmarking tools to evaluate and track Apple Pay performance by product and partner. This high-impact role includes frequent interactions with key internal and external partners. This role will have the opportunity to work directly across product, data science, engineering, business development and operations teams to influence Apple Pay’s strategic decision making.  
  
**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Minimum 3 years of experience in Consulting, Investment Banking, Corporate Strategy, Strategic Finance, and/or similar strategy and planning functions in a global, fast-paced organization
* Degree in Finance or a quantitative field from a top-tier institution

  
**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Excellent analytical and financial modeling skills; outstanding expertise in Excel
* Comfort with ambiguity. Ability to structure complex analysis through data analysis and strategy research
* Ability to communicate effectively, both in written and verbal form with senior leaders
* Ability to write data queries (eg. SQL) is strongly preferred. Knowledge of statistical languages such as R or Python, and data visualization (eg. Tableau) skills is also strongly preferred but not required
* Knowledge of digital payments, mobile commerce, or related industries is preferred

  
**Pay & Benefits**  
  
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $115,100 and $216,900, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.  
  
Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.  
  
Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.  
  
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant .

title: Contract Operations & Billing Analyst
description:
DESCRIPTION

Project Kuiper is an initiative to increase global broadband access through a constellation of 3,236 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO). Its mission is to bring fast, affordable broadband to unserved and underserved communities around the world. Project Kuiper will help close the digital divide by delivering fast, affordable broadband to a wide range of customers, including consumers, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in places without reliable connectivity. Export Control Requirement: Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum. The Analyst is a key part of the Commercial Revenue Operations of Kuiper. They will drive the processes in delivering invoices, contract onboarding and provisioning services by orchestrating orders to customers, ensuring a smooth and efficient customer experience. They will also optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of field technicians and teams responsible for installing, maintaining, and repairing infrastructure and services. The successful candidate will have experience leading complex strategic initiatives across global programs with cross-functional stakeholders. This requisition is for multiple positions within the Global Contract Operations, Order Orchestration and Billing Operations (GCOB) team. Candidates with experience in Contract Onboarding, Order Fulfillment and Billing Operations are welcome to apply.  
  
  
  
  
Key job responsibilities  
Global Contract Operations and Billing (GCOB) at Kuiper. The GCOB team is responsible for managing the entire customer lifecycle, from contract onboarding to service delivery and billing. This critical function ensures seamless customer experiences and accurate revenue recognition across Kuiper's global operations. Key Responsibilities: Contract Onboarding: Translate complex agreements into operational data Configure systems to reflect contract specifics Manage customer information and unique identifiers Implement terms, conditions, pricing, and service plans Order Orchestration: Manage end-to-end order lifecycle Coordinate hardware installation and service activation Track service delivery and resolve bottlenecks Manage customer communications throughout the process Billing Operations: Orchestrate billing cycles and revenue recognition Apply discounts, credits, and custom billing solutions Generate and deliver invoices Resolve billing disputes and manage tax compliance Monitor contract adherence and usage commitments The ideal candidate will have experience in satellite communications or similar complex service industries, strong analytical skills, and the ability to navigate intricate contractual and technical requirements. They should be adept at cross-functional collaboration and have a track record of implementing process improvements and automation initiatives to drive efficiency and scalability.  
  
Export Control Requirement:  
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.  
  
About the team  
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earth's most customer-centric company, and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in space-based systems design and wireless systems.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* 5 + years of relevant professional experience in Accounting / Finance Operations with expertise in Accounts Receivables or Order to Cash vertical.

- Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in business, accounting, or a related field - Intermediate / Advanced level of Excel skills and basic SQL knowledge.  

* Verbal/written communication and presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams
* If needed, flexible to work on rotational week off or based on roster to support business requirements.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience with financial contracts and comfortable with contractual language. Ability to read and interpret a customer contract and transform into a discounting/Billing solution.
* Strong attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills

- Ability to communicate effectively across all functions and levels of the organization - Highly organized, have multi-tasking skills, and efficient in ambiguous situations.  

* Customer Service Orientation with ability to use customer feedback to continually improve processes

  
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.  
  
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.  
  
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $79,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $169,500/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Principal PMT, SCOT - AIM - OIH
description:
DESCRIPTION

Do you want to work on a team where you are encouraged to build and have the autonomy to push boundaries? Invention has become second nature at Amazon, and the pace of innovation is only accelerating with breadth of our businesses expanding. Amazon’s growth requires leaders who move fast, have an entrepreneurial spirit to create new products, have an unrelenting tenacity to get things done, and are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems.  
  
Amazon SCOT-Optimal Inventory Health team is looking for a strong Principal PMT to re-imagine inventory optimization for it's Grocery business WW, a key investment area for Amazon. You will spearhead product strategy and partner closely with in-house Engineering, Science and Economics teams, to build new products/features to delight customers and deliver multi-million cost savings. This role has a combination of white space opportunity and known but highly complex priorities, and the successful PMT will be able to navigate a broad set of stakeholders and requirements with ease.
  
  
Key job responsibilities  

* Own product vision and roadmap for inventory optimization of Grocery business (including physical stores and online sales)
* Partner with Software Development, Research Science and Data Engineering teams to build new features, and develop new Machine Learning models to help reduce supply chain cost and improve profitability.
* Develop detailed business requirements that can be used to create software product specifications and design.
* Create buy-in for product vision both internally and externally and evangelize that vision.
* Manage delivery of current products concurrently with future product planning.
* Own strategic and operational product communications including developing and reporting on key metrics.

  
About the team  
Optimal Inventory Health (OIH) is a key part of Amazon's Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) - the decision engine behind Amazon's supply chain (watch this fun video about SCOT: https://youtu.be/ncwsr1Of6Cw). Every day, OIH systems look at every item sold by Amazon and our Selling Partners worldwide to determine if we like the inventory levels, and if not, do something about it. We use large-scale optimization and machine learning models to maximize the net present value of inventory, driving actions such as website pricing markdowns, deal creation and execution, as well as driving customers to find the products they want at prices they love through various channels, including search and ads.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's degree
* Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
* Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
* Experience technical product management

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience working directly with Engineers on product enhancements
* Experience in project management methodologies, business analysis, or process improvement

  
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.  
  
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $161,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $279,900/year in our highest geographic market. title: Lead, Supply Chain Business Analyst, NA
description:
**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**

You will collaborate with supply chain leadership and stakeholders and other business analysts to leverage data and drive business results. Your focus will include aligning data and performing analyses to drive network readiness and planning objectives, such as identifying risks at distribution centers (DCs), driving inventory health, planning efficient use of the North America Supply Chain, and ensuring future demand aligns with operational capacities.

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

We are seeking a motivated self-started with a proven ability to use data analysis to solve complex business challenges. This individual thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, is eager to learn new technologies, and can effortlessly transition between strategic long-term projects and ad-hoc tasks. This person is excited by taking a loosely defined problem and developing an analysis strategy to intelligently solve the problem. Success in this role requires a strong analysis foundation, the ability to tie data and analytics to business problems, a collaborative mindset, and the ability to work effectively within a team-oriented environment.

**Critical Experience Requirements:**

* Strong problem-solving and data storytelling skills to translate business challenges into actionable insights.
* Expertise with some of the following analytical tools is required (SQL, Excel, Tableau, Alteryx, Snowflake, Databricks, etc.) Python/R is a plus.
* Analytical methods knowledge is required to include regression, modeling methods, news vendor analyses, expected value calculations, etc.
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate and lead across teams and stakeholders to drive impactful results.
* Demonstrated ability to independently solve problems and story tell to senior leaders.
* Bachelor’s degree in analytics, mathematics, computer science, finance, or related fields. Will accept any suitable combination of education, experience and training.
* Minimum of 6-years of directly relevant work experience in supply chain, data analysis or related fields. Applicable additional experience in lieu of a bachelor’s degree may be acceptable.
* Ability to develop and clearly communicate strategic vision and purpose to internal and external partners, utilizing multiple platforms to drive clarity.

**Key Experiences to Gain:**

* Gain exposure to omnichannel supply chain operations and strategy
* Develop hands-on experience in building analyses to support trade-off decision-making to balance revenue, margin and operational efficiency
* Collaborate with diverse teams, including DC Operations, Accounts/Channels and Supply and Inventory Planning
* Senior leadership visibility and partnership across Supply Chain leadership
* Strengthen prioritization skills in a fast-paced dynamic environment
* Learn and apply new technologies and methodologies to drive innovation

**WHAT YOU’LL WORK ON**

In this role, you will leverage your analytical expertise and business knowledge to provide actionable insights that drive operational excellence and maximize revenue and margin. You will work cross-functionally to monitor and improve supply chain performance while contributing to the development of decision-making models and best practices for analytics:

* Mine and explore data sources to build analyses and data findings with clear action points to improve business operations
* Monitor and measure the health of the business through identifying and deploying success metrics in visualization
* Own and drive impactful insights including identifying continuous process improvement opportunities
* Perform analyses and apply modeling techniques to inform business decision making
* Track, trace and communicate omnichannel performance (e.g. DC health, inventory movement, etc.) and recommend solutions to Account, Channel and Seasonal teams
* Work with other business analysts to develop, leverage, and streamline reporting and analytics best practices
* Build, maintain, and elevate a decision-making model that will enable the MSC team to make better operational, tactical, and strategic decisions with regards to consumer value and profitability
* Participate in a "business analyst" network across the org to collaborate, share and learn

We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

title: Operations Analyst
description:
**What you will do**

Provide L1 support for US/Canada Mastermind applications and service platforms (Fire/Security Monitoring, Managed Access, Hosted Video)  
Provide support to facilitating the repair and maintenance of the devices and circuits that provide the link from our customer’s equipment to the Call Monitoring Centers

**How you will do it**

* Resolve operational, customer service and/or employee issues.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues, to ensure application uptime and availability. Ensure all incidents are resolved against SLAs.
* Initiate necessary action when irregular signals are received, or trouble develops.
* Work with outside repair technicians, guards, etc. to ensure that signals are received properly and that circuits and signaling devices are restored to normal operation.
* Must be able to adhere to standard operating procedures and special instructions.
* Respond quickly and precisely to incoming phone calls.
* Document all alarm activity and subscriber phone calls via PC and activity reports
* It is important to be able to work in a fast pace environment and keep your composure at all times.
* Team members must exhibit excellent communication skills, knowledge of computer applications, and flexibility to deal with change
* It is key to effectively utilize customer service skills to satisfy our customer’s needs and provide a satisfactory customer experience
* Work with team and strategic partners to diagnose, escalate and solve issues. Use data driven mindset to help with problem definition and solution.
* Perform other duties and special projects as assigned.

**What we look for**  
**Required**

* US Citizen
* Knowledge and 2 years’ experience with MASterMind Business/ Monitoring, and/or other industry specific monitoring, managed access, and hosted video systems.
* Knowledge and experience with IT systems and concepts
* Superior problem assessment and troubleshooting skills
* Strong communication skills and the ability to present technical topics to vendors, team members and non-technical audiences
* Must demonstrate the ability to work independently as well as part of a team and to interface with other teams as needed
* Strong service attitude and a commitment to quality
* *2nd shift- 2:00 pm – 10:30 pm MST*
* *Thursday and Fridays off*
* This position has the opportunity to work hybrid.

**Preferred**

* At least three years of customer service experience; in a call center environment preferred.
* Knowledge of Microsoft office and other required programs
* Problem solving skills
* Bilingual preferred a minimum the ability to understand and to make one’s self understood to all Spanish speaking individuals

**Hiring Compensation Range**: $44,600-66,900 USD (Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.) This position includes a competitive benefits package. For details, please visit the Employee Benefits tab on our main careers page at https://www.johnsoncontrols.com/careers.

**What else you’ll get**  
*Supportive team environment and add to that a competitive salary, best in class benefits package starting on day 1, which includes medical, dental & vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off and career growth opportunities.*

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
### **We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst!**

**Franklin County. OH**

*Join our team!*

Integrated Services for Behavioral Health (ISBH) is a community-minded, forward-thinking behavioral health organization helping people along the road to health and well-being. We meet people in their homes and communities and help connect them to the resources they need. We serve Southeastern and Central Ohio with a comprehensive array of behavioral health and other services, working with local partners to promote healthy people and strong communities. All of our services are intended to be collaborative and personalized for the individual.

This position will be responsible for gathering, cleaning, organizing, and reporting on data across multiple sources, locations, and departments within the organization in order to create reports, identify trends, and help drive business analytics. This position will also assist in the organization and management of our PowerBI environment to include all existing reports, workspaces, and access levels, and will help to satisfy the organization's reporting needs with changes to existing reports as well as ad-hoc reports as needed.

***The pay range for this position is $60,126.00 - $77,720.36 annually based on experience.***

**Essential Functions**

* Maintain and optimize existing data systems, ensuring high availability and data quality.
* Assists in the identification, planning, and execution of data migration between and amongst different systems on an as-needed basis.
* Routinely reviews and tests data feeds, data transformation routines, and data validity, and responds accordingly to ensure ongoing integrity.
* Troubleshoots production issues and develops proactive solutions for data quality and system performance issues.
* Act as a liaison between departments, facilitating communication and ensuring alignment on data-driven goals.
* Support and enhance ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for seamless data integration.
* Provide ongoing training and guidance to individuals and teams on using data, tools, dashboards, and reports.
* Design, refine, and implement interactive reports and dashboards using Power BI to support data-driven decision-making.
* Identifies and integrates data from multiple sources and builds dashboards and reports within Power BI environment that produces interactive and effective data analytics.
* Ensure reports and dashboards meet business needs and adhere to data quality standards.
* Maintains a detailed inventory of new and existing reports, dashboards, data feeds, and transformation routines.
* Analyze clinical and business data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
* Collaborate with management and stakeholders to address analytical needs and propose solutions and/or improvements.
* Leads the development of business intelligence solutions based on the requirements and strategic initiatives of business leadership.
* Takes part in ad hoc reporting projects as needed, including supporting users in determining reporting options within available applications.

* Other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Requirements**

* A bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Intelligence, or a related field is required.
* 3-4 years of experience with an Electronic Health Record (EHR) system to include report building or extracting data from the system for reporting purposes.
* Basic knowledge of SQL and Python; familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure or AWS); experience with Microsoft Power Platform and tools.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience applying a range of statistical analyses to practical decision-making contexts.
* Experience with web-based data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, D3, Google Charts) and data visualization design principles.
* Strong foundation in business intelligence principles.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
* A proactive mindset with a keen eye for detail and data integrity.

*This position requires moderate physical effort on a regular basis, as in frequent traveling, standing, walking, bending, prolonged sitting, stooping, or reaching and/or occasional lifting.*

**Enjoy a great work environment with an excellent salary, generous paid time off, and a strong benefits package.**

**Benefits include:**

* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Short-term Disability
* Long-term Disability
* 401K w/ Employer Match
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) provides support and resources to help you and your family with a range of issues.

**To learn more about our organization:** https://ISBH.org/

**OUR MISSION**  
Delivering exceptional care through connection

**OUR VALUES**  
**Dignity** - We meet people where they are on their journey with respect and hope

**Collaboration** - We listen to understand and ask how we can best support the people and communities we serve

**Wellbeing** - We celebrate one another's strengths, and we support one another in being well

**Excellence** - We demand high-quality care for those we serve, and are a leader in how we care for one another as a team

**Innovation** - We deeply value a range of perspectives and experiences, knowing it is what inspires us to stretch past where we are and reach towards what we know is possible

**We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.**
