title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
### **We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst!**

**Franklin County. OH**

*Join our team!*

Integrated Services for Behavioral Health (ISBH) is a community-minded, forward-thinking behavioral health organization helping people along the road to health and well-being. We meet people in their homes and communities and help connect them to the resources they need. We serve Southeastern and Central Ohio with a comprehensive array of behavioral health and other services, working with local partners to promote healthy people and strong communities. All of our services are intended to be collaborative and personalized for the individual.

This position will be responsible for gathering, cleaning, organizing, and reporting on data across multiple sources, locations, and departments within the organization in order to create reports, identify trends, and help drive business analytics. This position will also assist in the organization and management of our PowerBI environment to include all existing reports, workspaces, and access levels, and will help to satisfy the organization's reporting needs with changes to existing reports as well as ad-hoc reports as needed.

***The pay range for this position is $60,126.00 - $77,720.36 annually based on experience.***

**Essential Functions**

* Maintain and optimize existing data systems, ensuring high availability and data quality.
* Assists in the identification, planning, and execution of data migration between and amongst different systems on an as-needed basis.
* Routinely reviews and tests data feeds, data transformation routines, and data validity, and responds accordingly to ensure ongoing integrity.
* Troubleshoots production issues and develops proactive solutions for data quality and system performance issues.
* Act as a liaison between departments, facilitating communication and ensuring alignment on data-driven goals.
* Support and enhance ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for seamless data integration.
* Provide ongoing training and guidance to individuals and teams on using data, tools, dashboards, and reports.
* Design, refine, and implement interactive reports and dashboards using Power BI to support data-driven decision-making.
* Identifies and integrates data from multiple sources and builds dashboards and reports within Power BI environment that produces interactive and effective data analytics.
* Ensure reports and dashboards meet business needs and adhere to data quality standards.
* Maintains a detailed inventory of new and existing reports, dashboards, data feeds, and transformation routines.
* Analyze clinical and business data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
* Collaborate with management and stakeholders to address analytical needs and propose solutions and/or improvements.
* Leads the development of business intelligence solutions based on the requirements and strategic initiatives of business leadership.
* Takes part in ad hoc reporting projects as needed, including supporting users in determining reporting options within available applications.

* Other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Requirements**

* A bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Intelligence, or a related field is required.
* 3-4 years of experience with an Electronic Health Record (EHR) system to include report building or extracting data from the system for reporting purposes.
* Basic knowledge of SQL and Python; familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure or AWS); experience with Microsoft Power Platform and tools.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience applying a range of statistical analyses to practical decision-making contexts.
* Experience with web-based data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, D3, Google Charts) and data visualization design principles.
* Strong foundation in business intelligence principles.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
* A proactive mindset with a keen eye for detail and data integrity.

*This position requires moderate physical effort on a regular basis, as in frequent traveling, standing, walking, bending, prolonged sitting, stooping, or reaching and/or occasional lifting.*

**Enjoy a great work environment with an excellent salary, generous paid time off, and a strong benefits package.**

**Benefits include:**

* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Short-term Disability
* Long-term Disability
* 401K w/ Employer Match
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) provides support and resources to help you and your family with a range of issues.

**To learn more about our organization:** https://ISBH.org/

**OUR MISSION**  
Delivering exceptional care through connection

**OUR VALUES**  
**Dignity** - We meet people where they are on their journey with respect and hope

**Collaboration** - We listen to understand and ask how we can best support the people and communities we serve

**Wellbeing** - We celebrate one another's strengths, and we support one another in being well

**Excellence** - We demand high-quality care for those we serve, and are a leader in how we care for one another as a team

**Innovation** - We deeply value a range of perspectives and experiences, knowing it is what inspires us to stretch past where we are and reach towards what we know is possible

**We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.**

title: Payment Operations Analyst
description:
**Calling all innovators - find your future at Fiserv.**

We're Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another millions of times a day - quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we're involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

**Job Title**

Payment Operations Analyst

**What does a successful Payment Operations Analyst do?**

A successful Payment Operations Analyst at Fiserv is responsible for maintaining the Remittance Processing Pipeline to optimize bill pay payments delivery. This role involves performing critical tasks that support the accurate and efficient processing of payments for thousands of customers. The Analyst will be an expert in Fiserv's bill payment processing, solving complex problems, and providing remittance expertise to both internal and external business partners. This role requires a proactive, analytical problem solver with strong written and verbal communication skills who thrives in a fast-paced environment.

**What you will do:**

* Maintain and optimize the Remittance Processing Pipeline for bill pay payments.
* Implement new billers for electronic payments.
* Participate in and occasionally lead meetings with billers, clients, and internal business partners to support remittance implementations and projects.
* Update existing payment direction rules based on biller needs.
* Utilize SQL queries to search databases and conduct research.
* Research and analyze existing payment direction rules and consumer payment behavior to ensure optimal setup for electronic remittance and payment accuracy.
* Analyze payment delivery methods and existing rules to drive higher electronic rates.
* Respond to biller and internal partner inquiries related to payment remittance.

**What you will need to have:**

* 1+ years of experience in customer or client service.
* 1+ years of experience in managing and completing various work assignments in support of billers and payment processing.
* Strong understanding of Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel.
* Proficiency in SQL for database queries and research.
* High school diploma or equivalent and/or military experience.

**What would be great to have:**

* 1+ years of experience in banking or bill payment.
* Knowledge of SQL, SSRS, SSAS, ODS, EDW, or other data collection and presentation applications.
* Advanced knowledge of Excel.
* Four-year college degree or equivalent experience; business, mathematics, or statistics degree a plus.

**Perks at Work:**

* We’re #FiservProud of our commitment to your overall well-being with a growing offering of physical, mental, emotional, and financial benefits from day one.
* Maintain a healthy work-life balance with paid holidays, generous time off policies, including Unlimited Recharge & Refuel for qualifying associates, and free counseling through our EAP.
* Plan for your future with competitive salaries, the Fiserv 401(k) Savings Plan, and our Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
* Recognize and be recognized by colleagues with our Living Proof program where you can exchange points for a variety of rewards.
* Prioritize your health with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance options and a range of well-being resources through our Fuel Your Life program.
* Advance your career with training, development, certification, and internal mobility opportunities.
* Join Employee Resource Groups that promote our diverse and inclusive culture where associates can share perspectives, exchange ideas, and elevate careers.

**In order to be considered, you must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. without need for visa sponsorship, now or in the future.**

**Salary Range**

$56,900.00 - $95,600.00

*These pay ranges apply to employees in New Jersey, New York and California. Pay ranges for employees in other states may differ.*

It is unlawful to discriminate against a prospective employee due to the individual's status as a veteran.

This position is not eligible for an annual incentive opportunity and is also not eligible to earn commissions.

Thank you for considering employment with Fiserv. Please:

* Apply using your legal name
* Complete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable).

**Our commitment to Equal Opportunity:**

Fiserv is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by law.

If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation in completing a job application or otherwise participating in the overall hiring process, please contact AskHR.US@fiserv.com. Please note our AskHR representatives do not have visibility to your application status. Current associates who require a workplace accommodation should refer to Fiserv’s Disability Accommodation Policy for additional information.

**Note to agencies:**

Fiserv does not accept resume submissions from agencies outside of existing agreements. Please do not send resumes to Fiserv associates. Fiserv is not responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited resume submissions.

**Warning about fake job posts:**

Please be aware of fraudulent job postings that are not affiliated with Fiserv. Any communications from a Fiserv representative will come from a legitimate Fiserv email address.

title: Principal Financial Analyst - OCI Supply Chain Operations
description:
Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) is growing rapidly, and we are looking for a financial leader to support our Central Hub within the Supply Chain organization. This role focuses on capital forecasting, financial planning, and strategic analysis to support OCI’s infrastructure scaling initiatives. You will work closely with stakeholders across Engineering, Procurement, and Central Hub Operations to align financial plans with global execution. The ideal candidate has a background in supply chain finance, strong modeling and analysis skills, and thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.

* Serve as a key finance partner to OCI’s Central Hub within the global supply chain organization.
* Analyze supplier spend, material flow, and capital deployment trends.
* Build scalable financial models for vendor funding and supply chain execution.
* Translate complex operational data into actionable financial insights.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Engineering, Procurement, and Operations.
* Improve forecasting accuracy, financial systems, and process scalability.

  

Responsibilities

* Lead capital planning, forecasting, and budgeting efforts for OCI’s Central Hub supply chain operations.
* Analyze cost trends, vendor capacity, and material flow to inform financial strategy.
* Develop and maintain financial models to support vendor funding and infrastructure scaling.
* Create and deliver executive dashboards, quarterly business reviews, and KPI tracking.
* Work closely with Central Hub leaders, Engineering, and Procurement to align execution with financial goals.
* Partner with accounting and finance teams on quarter-end close activities and capital governance.
* Identify and communicate risks, cost drivers, and efficiency opportunities within the Central Hub network.
* Recommend and implement process improvements to enhance accuracy and reporting scalability.
* Contribute to cross-functional initiatives focused on optimizing OCI’s capital investment and supply chain footprint.

Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field; MBA or CPA preferred.
* 8+ years of corporate finance experience, ideally in supply chain or operations finance.
* Expertise in financial modeling and Excel; experience with Oracle Financials, Hyperion, or similar systems preferred.
* Demonstrated ability to derive insights from complex data and present clear business recommendations.
* Experience supporting capital investment, procurement, or vendor strategy is a plus.
* Strong communication skills and executive presence.
* Ability to manage competing priorities and work effectively in a matrixed, fast-paced environment.
* Passion for process improvement, scalability, and automation.
* Preferred: Direct experience supporting a centralized supply chain hub or capital-heavy operations.
Preferred: experience leading or contributing to cross-functional process improvement initiatives in a global finance or supply chain environment

title: Air-Surface Operations Analyst (ALO/JTAC)
description:
Air-Surface Operations Analyst (ALO/JTAC)

R&K Enterprise Solutions, Inc. (R&K) is a certified Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) with core capabilities in Mission Support, Engineering and Logistics, Cybersecurity and Intelligence, Environmental and Emergency Management, Exercise and Training, and Defense Healthcare in support of our Defense, Intelligence, and Federal Civilian customers.

Exercise GREEN FLAG provides a training venue for joint United States and coalition aircrew, air liaison officers, joint terminal attack controllers (JTACS), battle management personnel and weapons system operators in the planning and execution of joint air ground operations in counter-land operations. R&K provides subject matter expertise (SME) necessary to support GREEN FLAG tactical exercises.

**Title:** Air-Surface Operations Analyst (ALO/JTAC)

**Location:** Ft. Irwin, CA

**Duration:** Permanent/Full-Time

**Clearance:** Secret Clearance and SAP Eligible

**Start Date:** Upon Approval

**Salary:** The full salary range for this position is $74,000 to $80,000 per year, with the starting salary determined based on candidate's knowledge, skills, experience, as well as budget availability.

**Duties:**

The successful candidate will provide Tactical Air Control Part (TACP) and Air Support Operations Center (ASOC) SME support to the Green Flag Support Element at Ft. Johnson as part of the 57 OG.

The candidate will support the team with air ground expertise specifically focused on ASOC/TACP operations during training events. This includes exercise planning/after-action support; utilize the Air Tasking Order and Master Air Attack Plan to track tasked missions and monitor missions available for tasking; process both immediate and pre-planned DD Form 1972 Tactical Air Strike Requests (JTASR); operate and trouble-shoot tactical radios and load crypto; manage/update web based programs with current ASOC rotational content; adjudicate battle damage assessment; coordinate with Airspace Command and Control to de-conflict fixed wing assets with Army aviation assets and counter-fire missions; track active Restricted Operating Zones (ROZ); create Close Air Support (CAS) ROZs for Airspace Control Order; provide area of operation updates and assigned airspace to inbound fighters and receive mission results/bomb damage assessment from outbound fighters.

**Requirements:** The candidate shall meet the following qualifications:

* Experience as a USAF Air Liaison Officer (ALO), Joint Terminal Attack Controller (JTAC), or USMC Air Officer (AO).
* Secret Clearance Required
* Experience processing JTASRs.
* Operations analysis with experience working CAS
* Ability to multi-task, and work within a team construct.
* Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Teams).

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 4+ years of experience as a JTAC
* Completed Joint Firepower Course
* Proficient with Microsoft Visual Basic (VBA)

**R&K Enterprise Solutions, Inc. is an equal opportunity affirmative action employer committed to cultural diversity and compliance. All qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply for R&K job vacancies. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.**

title: Sr. Associate Business Systems Analyst
description:
ABOUT AMGEN

Amgen harnesses the best of biology and technology to fight the world’s toughest diseases, and make people’s lives easier, fuller, and longer. We discover, develop, manufacture, and deliver innovative medicines to help millions of patients. Amgen helped establish the biotechnology industry more than 40 years ago and remains on the cutting-edge of innovation, using technology and human genetic data to push beyond what is known today.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Role Description:

The role uses domain and business process expertise to detail product requirements as user stories, along with supporting artifacts like business process maps, use cases, and test plans for the software development teams.

This role requires working closely with Business stakeholders, Engagement Leads and the Product Delivery Team to ensure that the user requirements are thoroughly elaborated. This enables the delivery team to estimate, plan, and commit to delivery with high confidence and identify test cases to ensure the quality and performance of software solutions.

Roles & Responsibilities:

* Work with Product Owners and customers to define scope and value for software solutions.

* Capture the voice of the customer to define business processes and product needs.

* Collaborate with Engineering, testing teams as well as Product Management to prioritize release scope and groom the Product backlog.

* Facilitate the breakdown of Use Cases into Features and Sprints and participate in backlog reviews with the development team.

* Clearly express features in User Stories/requirements so all team members and collaborators understand how they fit into the product backlog.

* Maintain and ensure the quality of documented user stories/requirements in tools such as Jira.

* Ensure Feature Acceptance Criteria and Definition of Done are well-defined.

* Work closely with UX to align technical requirements, scenarios, and business process maps with User Experience designs.

* Validate that test scenarios meet feature acceptance criteria and customer expectations.

* Stay focused on software development to ensure it meets requirements, providing proactive feedback to collaborators.

* Develop and implement effective product demonstrations for internal and external collaborators.

Basic Qualifications and Experience:

* Master’s degree  
  OR  
  Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of Business Systems Analysis experience  
  OR  
  Associate’s degree and 6 years of Business Systems Analysis experience  
  OR
    
  High school diploma / GED and 8 years of Business Systems Analysis experience

Functional Skills:

**Must-Have Skills:**

* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with senior leadership with confidence and clarity.

* Three years’ experience with value capture and tracking.

* Three years’ experience with success story creation using multiple modalities and communication channels (e.g., email, power point, SharePoint, and video).

* Experience as a Scrum Master in Agile and SAFe environments.

* Experience in writing user requirements and acceptance criteria for development of modern applications.

**Good-to-Have Skills:**

* Experience in handling product features for PI planning and developing product roadmaps and user journeys

* Able to communicate complex subject matters in business terms

* Jira Align experience

* Miro experience

* Familiarity with GxP, CFR 21 Part 11 and systems validation

Soft Skills:

* Able to work under minimal supervision

* Shows ability to effectively delegate work.

* Excellent analytical and gap/fit assessment skills.

* Strong verbal and written communication skills

* Ability to work effectively with global, virtual teams

* High degree of initiative and self-motivation.

* Ability to prioritize successfully.

* Team-oriented, with a focus on achieving team goals

* Strong presentation and public speaking skills.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

title: Continuous Improvement Specialist
description:
AP EMISSIONS TECHNOLOGIES LLC

As a part of the global industrial organization Marmon Holdings—which is backed by Berkshire Hathaway—you’ll be doing things that matter, leading at every level, and winning a better way. We’re committed to making a positive impact on the world, providing you with diverse learning and working opportunities, and fostering a culture where everyone’s empowered to be their best.

The Continuous Improvement Specialist is responsible for analyzing and improving business processes to improve safety, quality, productivity and reduce cost together with operations leadership.

***Please Note that this is an*** ***ONSITE Role*** ***and no hybrid option will be given.***
=============================================================================================

The Continuous Improvement Specialist also must lead, co-implement, and maintain all processes, procedures, and system improvements in the manufacturing facilities; these processes and procedures should generate long-term benefits that involve and engage the entire workforce. The continuous improvement methods implemented should include programs such as 5S, Lean Manufacturing, Kaizen, Six Sigma, 8-D, Problem Solving and Value Stream Map and analysis to drive out waste and improve efficiency and productivity.

While based at a single facility, this role is a key position within a team responsible for the delivery of process innovation and continuous improvement initiatives across multi-jurisdictions. It will play an important role in helping to foster a culture of sustainable change through implementation and promotion of Lean principles.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Identify and address root causes of issues negatively impacting manufacturing objectives.
* Conduct time studies and workflow analyses to improve manufacturing processes.
* Provide labor ROI and work content data to senior leadership.
* Implement and maintains processes that sustain continuous improvement gains
* Reviews and assists with routing and/or other process flows created by manufacturing.
* Lead studies focused on safety, cost, quality, productivity, flow, and Value Stream Mapping (VSM).
* Lead and coordinates a wide variety of identified and approved initiatives and projects designed to improve processes and performance.
* Establish, lead, and maintain Continuous Improvement (CI) contributor teams.
* Facilitate the selection, scoping, and planning of specific improvement initiatives.
* Set measurable goals for CI events and quantify potential savings.
* Identify resource requirements and ROI estimates for improvement projects.
* Lead Kaizen events, document outcomes, and track action plans and results.
* Monitor and maintain event schedules.
* Audit event progress to ensure results are achieved and sustained.
* Resolve implementation issues and manage project communication processes.
* Participate in new product development and/or product change initiatives.
* Review and refine QA procedures.
* Analyze manufacturing processes to identify efficiency gains during new product introductions or product changes.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Strong self-motivation and initiative.
* Comfortable acting as a trainer and agent of change.
* Ability to engage, influence and work collaboratively across all levels of the organization
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong organizational and project management skills.
* Advanced computer proficiency (e.g., Excel, SQL).
* Results-oriented with a proven track record of accomplishments.
* Effective at managing multiple priorities and assignments simultaneously.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to assess challenges, develop viable solutions, and implement comprehensive action plans.

**Education, Credentials, and Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Industrial Engineering or Manufacturing Engineering is a plus); or 5+ years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in continuous improvement, including project management and business analysis.
* Lean certification preferred; Six Sigma certification is a plus.
* Proficiency in Total Quality Management (TQM) processes.
* Experience developing employee training programs.
* Leadership or training experience in addition to industry experience is highly desirable.
* Proficient in drafting, spreadsheets, word processing, and database management.
* Expertise in Time and Motion Studies.
* Familiarity with workflow and methods analysis.
* Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Experience with process automation and technology solutions is a plus.
* Familiarity with OSHA standards and their application in the workplace.

Following receipt of a conditional offer of employment, candidates will be required to complete additional job-related screening processes as permitted or required by applicable law.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to careers@marmon.com, and please be sure to include the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.

title: Business Analyst - National Remote
description:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

This position is for Part D Formulary Operations, Business Analyst position. The position is needed for adding and validating product information in formulary applications to support downstream teams and customers that reference this information. The position also performs daily validation and quality analysis against formulary data to insure accurate product setup and correct adjudication for Part D members. The accuracy of this information is critical as it must comply with CMS rules and regulations.

  

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely \\* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Data analysis, file management and report validation required
* Produce, publish and distribute scheduled and adhoc reports while meeting deadlines
* Ability to problem solve and research inaccurate data
* Prepare formulary files for RxWeb and look up tools
* Prepare Prior Auth and Step files for RxWeb
* Review completed reports used for formulary validation
* Communicate analysis to peers and leaders
* Provide support to internal and/or external customers on issue mitigation
* Perform other duties as necessary to meet department objectives supporting clients and/or COE objectives

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma / GED
* 2+ years of experience in a PBM and healthcare
* 2+ years of experience with Microsoft Excel utilizing v-lookups and Formulas
* 2+ years of experience with data analysis, identifying anomalies and discrepancies
* 1+ years of experience with Medicare Part D and Part D Guidance

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* RxCLAIM/AS400 experience
* SQL work experience
* Knowledge of Medispan data system including GPI drug classification system and First Data Bank
* Familiarity with prescription benefit, formulary, and clinical program design

  

**Soft Skills:**

* Collaborative yet able to work independently
* Meticulous and high level of attention to detail
* Solid written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to ask questions, be curious and research solutions
* Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills
* Solid customer service orientation and commitment to professionalism
* Flexibility in a changing environment

  

* All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

  

Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, we offer benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with us, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. The hourly pay for this role will range from $28.27 to $50.48 per hour based on full-time employment. We comply with all minimum wage laws as applicable

  

**Application Deadline**: This will be posted for a minimum of 2 business days or until a sufficient candidate pool has been collected. Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  

*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

#RPO
company_description: Optum is a health services and innovation company on a mission to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.

title: IT Solutions Delivery Lead, R&D Operations
description:
Job Description

Location: San Rafael, Ca

Company Description

BioMarin is the world leader in delivering therapeutics that provide meaningful advances to patients who live with serious and life-threatening rare genetic diseases. We target diseases that lack effective therapies and affect relatively small numbers of patients, many of whom are children. These conditions are often inherited, difficult to diagnose, progressively debilitating, and have few, if any, treatment options. BioMarin will continue to focus on advancing therapies that are the first or best of their kind.

By providing a foundation for all operations company wide, BioMarin’s General and Administrative teams support our mission of providing first and best in class therapeutics to patients who live with rare diseases. Our teams include groups such as finance, legal, human resources, corporate compliance and ethics, and information technology. Come join our team and make a meaningful impact on patients’ lives.

About the Opportunity

The IT Solutions Delivery Lead, R&D Operations role is critical to ensuring successful development and delivery of Information Technology strategies which emphasize the IT organization’s leadership role in “managing information technology” which includes System Ownership for the R&D organization’s systems which allow the business to focus on what they are best at.

The R&D organization is responsible for everything from research and discovery to post-market clinical development. Our customers include Research, Clinical Sciences, BioMetrics, Clinical Development/Operations, Pharmacovigilance, Regulatory, Medical Affairs, etc.

The position will maintain full time engagement to the R&D department and continually capture and examine the unique needs and concerns of the business to manage the standard support practices and procedures for identifying, scoping, developing, testing, and releasing/publishing R&D business systems. The position will provide system support, maintenance, licensing, data management and project delivery for the life of their systems.

Will be an integral part of the global R&D IT Solution Delivery and Support team, with responsibility for developing, maintaining, monitoring, and supporting an industry specific set of R&D Operations systems. Will work closely with the business SME’s and IT project managers to capture and prioritize all requests for the R&D department and address and/or escalate any data, process and technical issues that inhibit the vision and enhanced efficiencies of the business needs and change.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

System Ownership

* Technical ownership of SAS 9.4, SAS Viya, R-Studio, Phoenix WinNonLin, PumasAI, etc.

* Lifecycle Management of applications to deliver business capabilities while ensuring efficient allocation of resources across our technology landscape.

* Financial responsibility of all system operational expenses.

* Manage Software Vendors to ensure SLAs are met and system is up to date.

* Manage Licensing for your systems including budgeting and growth forecasting.

* Facilitate Application Steering Committees to maximize value delivered by applications and always improve UX.

* Participate in change control boards and design review committees.

* Bridge the gap between business needs and technology constraints to develop the right strategy/solution for the company.

Project Delivery

* Support new application and system deployment projects with an emphasis on the software development life cycle (SDLC).

* Participate as subject matter expert (and in some cases lead) projects with project managers, technicians, and business analysts.

* Develop and implement technical strategies for various validated/qualified computer systems with an emphasis on global enterprise systems.

* Partner with the business team to implement next-gen applications and upgrade existing applications.

* Develop Solution Options based on user requirements including level of effort and cost estimates.

* Champion internal IT standards and best practices during the design/implementation phase of a project.

* Provide analytical support for multiple complex projects; establish work plans and timelines; co-ordinate with internal and external sources.

* Organize technical requirements gathering and solution design sessions with customers, partners, and other technical resources of all levels.

* Developing support plan and ensuring smooth turnover of operations.

System Administration

* Responsible for managing, administering, configuring, and maintaining business application operations through the System Development Lifecycle.

* Manage Vendors and Service Providers to ensure system support needs are met.

* Provide technical guidance to peers, contingent staff, and support vendors.

* Communicate system outages, changes, and overall status to key business stakeholders.

* Maintains systems under department control in qualified state by establishing and enforcing platform standards aligning with Quality Assurance and Computer System Validation policy, along with Health Authority regulations.

* Develop and administer system procedures for installation, monitoring, performance utilization, upgrades, backups, recovery, and overall operations in a validated environment.

* Develops and maintains reports, scorecards, and tools to enable regular business monitoring of system key indicators.

* Provide tier 3 developer support for your systems, e.g., root cause analysis, working with IT peer technology SMEs, and working with vendor support to resolve issues.

* Prioritize and support R&D related incident/service tickets related to owned systems.

* Continuous improvement of support processes.

* Track, prioritize, and fulfill all system enhancement requests.

* Plan, build, deploy, secure, integrate, and support application solutions for R&D.

* Work schedule may include ‘out of normal’ work hours for IT support & maintenance.

Skills and Attributes

* Decision Making: The ability to make sound and effective decisions from all available information.

* Collaboration: Seek the perspective of others and partner with others across and outside the organization to define and reach a shared goal. Persuade by effectively sharing information. Influence is based on credibility and earning the respect of others.

* Agility and Problem Solving: An adaptable and flexible attitude, allowing you to approach and solve a problem by examining it from different angles. Strongly developed problem-solving skills are crucial in this role.

* Leadership: Strong Leadership Skills in Project Definition, Mitigation, and overall Delivery. Ability to provide constructive feedback to vendors and service providers. Ability to set technical direction to project teams and upper management for your systems.

* Organization: This role demands high level organizational skills as you will be managing all aspects of your systems from build and maintain to financial accrual and forecasting.

* Communication: Written and verbal communication to gather information about a problem and propose solutions. Required to communicate with team members of all levels.

* Technical: Deep understanding of SAS architecture (SAS Grid, SAS Viya, SAS 9.4, etc.) Proficiency in Linux/Unix and Windows server environments. Shell scripting for automation and troubleshooting. Familiarity with SQL and connecting SAS to databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, etc.) ETL processes and data warehousing concepts. Managing user roles, permissions, and authentication (LDAP, Active Directory). Understanding of encryption, data masking, and compliance requirements. Load balancing and resource management in grid environments. Implementing disaster recovery plans. Regular backups of metadata and configuration files. Automating tasks using shell scripts, Python, or SAS macros. Scheduling jobs using tools like cron, LSF, or SAS Job Scheduler.

* Project management: Strongly developed organizational and time management skills to move a project from start to finish.

Education and Experience

* Bachelor of Science or greater in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Technology, Biology, Chemistry or a related technical field or significant experience in supporting research systems in the pharmaceutical industry.

* Desire to have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in technical or business analyst role with a focus on R&D functional systems and/or Information Technology.

* Experience in computer database management, programming, or software development familiar with developing Power Apps and Power Automate.
* Experience with Pharma/BioTech R&D systems such as SAS 9.4, SAS Viya, R-Studio, Phoenix WinNonLin, PumasAI, etc.

* Data analysis expertise familiar with database technologies such as SQL, Oracle, Excel, Power BI, etc.

* Delivering mid-to-large size projects with teams of 5 to 15 members on time and within budget.

* Have a general knowledge of the underlying scientific principles applied to the development and manufacture of biopharmaceuticals.

Note: This description is not intended to be all-inclusive, or a limitation of the duties of the position. It is intended to describe the general nature of the job that may include other duties as assumed or assigned.
  
  
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
  
  
An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

The salary range for this position is: $112,000 to $154000. BioMarin considers a variety of factors when determining base compensation, including experience, qualifications, and geographic location. These considerations mean actual compensation will vary. This position may also be eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, discretionary stock-based long-term incentives (eligibility may vary based on role), paid time off, and a benefits package. Benefits include company-sponsored medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans.  
  
For additional benefits information, visit: **https://careers.biomarin.com/benefits**.  

* Eligible employees may participate in benefit plans, subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable plans.
company_description: We transform lives through genetic discovery.

title: Corporate Development Analyst
description:
Healthcare Without Rival

Premise Health is the world's leading direct healthcare provider and one of the largest digital providers in the country, serving over 11 million eligible lives across more than 2,500 of the largest commercial and municipal employers in the U.S. Premise partners with its clients to offer fully connected care – in-person and in the digital environment. It operates more than 800 onsite and nearsite wellness centers in 45 states and Guam, delivering care through the Digital Wellness Center and onsite, nearsite, mobile, and event solutions.

Premise delivers value by simplifying complexity and breaking down barriers to give diverse member populations access to convenient, integrated, high-quality care. We offer more than 30 products, delivering the breadth and depth of care required to serve organizations' total populations. The result is healthcare that meets the needs of members and their families, helping them live healthier while lowering costs for organizations.

Premise offers a wide range of dynamic, purpose-driven career opportunities. We are currently looking for a Corporate Development Analyst to join our team in Brentwood, TN. This is a hybrid position in office 2-3 days per week.

About the role:

The Corporate Development team at Premise Health is looking to add talent at the analyst level to further support M&A, partnerships, and other strategic growth initiatives. The position is responsible for working with cross functional teams, including leaders across the organization, to coordinate the research, diligence, development, enhancement, and execution of complex, high profile projects. The positions will also be responsible for performing financial analysis and modeling, market analysis, business case building, business process analysis, and documenting business and strategic requirements as well as current state and future state to help position the organization for future growth and success. This team member must demonstrate a collaborative approach in a team environment with hands-on business analysis and problem-solving skills, strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and a strong concentration in functional analysis.

Essential Functions:

* Performs deal-related analysis, including financial modeling and due diligence review and management
* Supports due diligence process, including communication with target companies and bankers, manage diligence lists, and delegate action items to internal subject matter experts
* Assists in development of enterprise strategy roadmap and content to accelerate education efforts and inform future build, buy, or partner decisions
* Supports enterprise partnership evaluation process and execution of partnerships, including communication with external parties, business case creation, financial opportunity evaluation, and contracting process
* Assists in the preparation of presentations and reports for senior leadership, executive team, and board of directors
* Tracks sourcing efforts for M&A and enterprise partnerships and facilitate execution of legal agreements, including NDAs and other transaction documents
* Supports gathering of market intelligence via research and internal cross-functional collaboration, and leads the aggregation, analysis, and dissemination of insights across the enterprise to inform strategic decision-making
* Completes assigned tasks, ad hoc requests, projects in accordance with assigned timeframes and present analyses and findings to stakeholders
* Works with cross functional teams to identify, research, and analyze opportunities and strategies for growth and improvement
* Responsible for managing multiple projects including the development, implementation, and support for assigned projects
* Understands the business as a whole and takes ownership in an effort to become a proactive partner in idea generation and messaging
* Comfortable communicating organizational goals and priorities to external parties, including targets, bankers, potential partners, etc.
* Sets up, facilitates, and takes notes for meetings with internal and external parties

Job Requirements:

* Bachelor's Degree required
* Graduate Degree - MBA preferred

Preferred Experience :

* 1-4 years of prior experience in consulting, investment banking, venture capital, private equity, corporate strategy or corporate finance required
* Experience with designing, implementing, and executing projects which involve numerous stages and stakeholders
* Experience with modeling, financial analysis, and developing business cases
* Experience establishing & maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of an organization
* Experience with and knowledge of healthcare services highly preferred
* Proactive and detail-oriented, with a team-first mindset
* Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
* Entrepreneurial spirit with ability to thrive in a dynamic and changing environment
* Excellent problem-solving skills and demonstrated business analytics and financial modeling abilities
* Superior verbal and written communication skills, with excellent presentation skills, confident in all settings with individuals at all levels of an organization, including internally and externally
* Ability to communicate information succinctly and create a cohesive and compelling narrative throughout a presentation or other deliverable
* Advanced level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: using VLOOKUP function, IF logic, IRR, pivot tables, and other financial modeling functions)
* Advanced level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: changing picture styles, customizing animation and/or setting automatic slide timings)

Work-life balance is at the foundation of how decisions are made and where Premise is headed. We can only help people get, stay, and be well if we do the same for ourselves. In addition to competitive pay, Premise offers benefits packages including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), paid holidays and vacation time, a company-sponsored wellness program, and much more our talent acquisition team will be happy to share with you.

Premise Health is an equal opportunity employer; we value inclusion, and we do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.

title: Business Analyst - Sheriff's Office
description:
**JOB SPECIFICS**
-----------------

The Washington County Sheriff's Office is currently hiring for a Business Analyst. Under limited supervision, this position gathers the requirements to plan, analyze, design, configure, test, train, and implement systems, processes, and applications in a variety of technical areas, documents, and analyzes findings, and has responsibility for assigned duties on smaller scale projects.  
  
**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

* A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or related field and four (4) years of business analysis work experience; OR
* An Associate degree in Information Technology or related field and six (6) years of business analysis work experience; OR
* An equivalent combination of education and job-related work experience that totals eight (8) years of experience in business analysis

**DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE:**

* Previous paid work experience with CentralSquare Technologies (formerly Tritech), Structured Query Language (SQL), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and criminal justice databases
* Paid work experience with project management or business analysis tools
* Paid work experience in public safety or emergency services
* Paid work experience interpreting and applying mandated FCC rules and regulations as well as state and local laws governing the operations of the system to include CJIS Security Policies

**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:**

* Knowledge of Scrum/LEAN or other Quality Improvement Concepts
* Experience identifying policy issues and provide planning direction and recommendations to policymakers regarding the operation of the law enforcement, fire, and public safety system and related technologies

 **SELECTION TECHNIQUE:** Your training and experience will be rated based on the required application material submitted and the top-scoring candidates will be forwarded to the hiring department for further consideration.  
  
**HOURS / DAYS****:** 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., Monday-Friday. Circumstances may arise within public safety that require longer or varied hours on occasion.  
  
**ANTICIPATED HIRING RATE:** $37.11 to $43.88 Hourly  
  
**E-Verify Participation:** Washington County participates in the federal E-Verify program. This means that Washington County will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee's Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. If the Government cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, Washington County is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact DHS and/or the SSA before taking adverse action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers may not use E-Verify to pre-screen job applicants and may not limit or influence the choice of documents you present for use on the Form I-9.  
E- Verify Participation  
Right to work Poster

**JOB SUMMARY**
---------------

The Sheriff's Office Business Analyst, under limited supervision, gathers the requirements to plan, analyze, design, configure, test, train, and implement systems, processes, and applications in a variety of technical areas, documents and analyzes findings, and has responsibility for assigned duties on smaller-scale projects.

**EMPLOYMENT CRITERIA**
-----------------------

CORE COMPETENCIES, JOB SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED FOR SUCCESSFUL JOB PERFORMANCE  
  
Core Competencies outline essential business and professional traits necessary to perform this job.  

* Promote a diverse, culturally competent, and respectful workplace;
* Demonstrates knowledge of business and technology architecture and infrastructure;
* Demonstrates knowledge of systems development and lifecycle methodology;
* Demonstrates knowledge of business and technical analysis and research techniques;
* Demonstrates knowledge of data modeling tools;
* Demonstrates knowledge of project management principles;
* Demonstrates skill in providing IT training;
* Demonstrates the ability to create and interpret detailed specifications;
* Demonstrates ability to document procedures;
* Facilitates in analyzing computer hardware and software problems; and
* Facilitates troubleshooting, repairing, configuring, and administering systems in a domain or workgroup environment.

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**
-----------------------------

Provide analysis and solution definition:  

* Gather user requirements and develop, validate and secure acceptance of business requirements documents;
* Document and evaluate work processes and business re-engineering opportunities;
* Create business process models and information models (user cases, data flow diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams);
* Translate business requirements into functional specifications;
* May research software and hardware products and recommend systems and applications for purchase; and may participate in the creation of technology recommendations.

Provide project strategy support:  

* Provide input to the project plan to define the scope, work breakdown, and task assignments;
* Confirm project business requirements and ensure successful completion;
* Help with planning, design, and implementation of new and enhanced applications or systems; and create and execute test plans that ensure the accuracy, integrity, and usability of applications.

Provide ongoing support:  

* Troubleshoot issues as needed;
* May provide training to end-users; and
* May provide guidance to other staff members.

Perform other duties as assigned.  
  
**WORK ENVIRONMENT**  
  
The work will involve remaining in a stationary position for extended periods of time, although the incumbent will need to move about inside the office to access files or equipment from time to time, and may occasionally need to travel to other sites to perform work or interact with other professionals. The ability to operate and interact with computers or other office equipment, via keyboard, mouse, touch screen or other Human Interface Device (HID) is required. The incumbent will be exposed to noise and a regular flow of people around an office environment, assigned to changing priorities and occasionally required to work outside of typical business hours to meet project deadlines, or be available on an on-call basis for special projects or to provide support.  
  
Additional physical/mental requirements that occur may not be listed above, but are inherent in performing the position's essential functions.

***This job description is intended to describe the kinds of tasks and level of work difficulty being performed by people assigned to this classification. The list of responsibilities is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. The County retains the discretion to add or change the contents of this job description at any time.***

title: Data Analyst (Business-Focused)
description:
**Position Title: Data Analyst (Business-Focused)**

**Position Summary**

The Data Analyst will support the ESCAPE program by bridging business and technical teams to ensure accurate, efficient, and secure data integration across legacy and modern systems. This role focuses on documenting inbound and outbound data requirements, mapping data sources to ESCAPE’s ODS, and ensuring alignment with AF Standards. The analyst will also support interface development, data quality assurance, and business rule documentation to enable seamless supply chain operations.

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* Interrogate, map, and document source-to-target schema and data relationships

* Identify, refine, and maintain data mappings (metadata) of input and output system sources

* Document business rules, processing logic, and transformation actions by system to support data ingestion and outbound feeds

* Collaborate with developers, data engineers, and functional SMEs to define and validate data requirements

* Participate in configuration management processes and interface prioritization discussions

* Ensure compliance with data governance, security, and quality standards

title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY BUSINESS ANALYST-LIBRARY IT - Justin Schluter
description:
This class provides initiative-taking technical expertise to facilitate the effective use of technology products and services by its customers. This is a non-supervisory position which may lead teams and projects. This position is located at Escambia County’s Downtown office in Pensacola, Florida.

  

**EXAMPLES OF DUTIES**

Analyzes business processes and leverages technology to provide solutions to meet our user partner’s needs

  

Provides project management, coordination and/or technical support during project implementation

  

Performs complex troubleshooting procedures and system and data analysis in resolving user problems reported to the service desk

  

Provides consulting which includes, but is not limited to, assisting customers with standard products and implementing local solutions and configurations

  

Integrates new and existing systems to minimize duplication and enhance information collection and dissemination

  

Research trends related to information systems and business applications; attends a variety of meetings, conferences, and user groups

  

Prepares a variety of technical documentation, procedures, standards, and/or reports regarding projects and applications

  

Integrates, tests, deploys, implements and/or maintains software and applications

  

Assists user partner with data and reporting needs and provides specialized, dedicated technical support

  

Educate customers on how to use standard products more effectively

  

Identify training opportunities

  

Performs other duties as assigned

  

**TYPICAL QUALIFICATIONS**

**Minimum Qualification Requirements:**

  

**Training and Experience:**

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Information Systems, Business, Management Information Systems, or related field, and 2 years’ experience in computer application development, systems administration, network applications or PC support; or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above.

  

**Licenses and Certifications:**

Must possess a valid driver's license from state of residence

  

**Preferred Qualification Requirements:**

in-depth technical knowledge of the Microsoft Office 365 Suite of products. (i.e., Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Teams, PowerBI)

ability to program SQL, PowerShell, VB, C++ or .Net

knowledge of relational database design

  

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Other Characteristics (KSAOs):**

analyze business processes and make recommendations for leveraging technology to improve processes.

knowledge of standard office practices, procedures, policies, personal computers, operating systems, and related software applications.

manage projects using good Project management principles and techniques

troubleshooting complex hardware, software, database, and/or network problems

querying enterprise relational databases

determining customer needs

communicate technical information to a non-technical audience

excellent analytical skills

organizational skills and strong customer service orientation

excellent communication, interpersonal skills

seek opportunities to learn and transfer knowledge to others

demonstrate initiative and a proactive approach to daily tasks

setup, configure, upgrade, manage, and troubleshoot

establish and maintain effective relationships with public officials, department heads, employees, and the general public

  

**SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION**

**County-wide Employee Responsibilities:**

All Escambia County BCC employees must serve the public and fellow employees with honesty and integrity in full accord with the letter and spirit of Escambia County BCC's Employee Code of Ethics, gift, and conflict of interest policies.

  

All Escambia County BCC employees must establish and maintain effective working relationships with the general public, co-workers, elected and appointed officials and members of diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, political affiliation, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, or gender identity and expression.

  

**Emergency Management Responsibilities:**

During emergency conditions, the incumbent of this position will automatically be considered an emergency service worker. This employee is subject to being called to work in the event of a disaster, such as a hurricane, or other emergency situations and is expected to perform emergency service duties, as assigned.

  

**Physical Requirements:**

Positions in this class typically require sitting, standing, talking, hearing, seeing, finger and hand dexterity as well as repetitive motions. Sedentary Work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally. Sedentary work involves sitting frequently during the day. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally, and all other sedentary criteria are met.

  

**Benefits/Compensation Package:**

* Medical / Dental / Vision plans

* Prescription coverage

* Employee health clinic

* Employee fitness centers

* Employer-sponsored retirement plan or an investment plan

* Deferred Compensation Plan

* Flexible Spending Account(s)

* Employee Assistance Program

* Annual/Sick Leave or Paid Time Off (PTO)

* Group Life Insurance

title: ERP Business Analyst - Microsoft D365 Business Central
description:
**Who We Are:**

Founded in 1958, K&M Manufacturing Co., originally K&M Manufacturing and Repair, pioneered with toolboxes and steps, transforming agricultural practices. Our expansion into tractor seats marked the inception of a product line now exceeding 2,500 innovative items, ranging from seats and suspensions to mirrors and warning light systems. Tailored for leading tractor and mower brands, our 32,000 sq. ft. production space and over 40,000 sq. ft. warehouse cater to diverse field needs, reflecting our commitment to innovation and quality since inception.

**Why Choose K&M?**

We provide an industry leading benefits package to cover healthcare, retirement, and wellness programs to help you be your best self financially and physically. On top of that, we have:

* Competitive Pay: $102-105k annually, plus 5-10% AIP eligibility, with your exact compensation personalized based on your skills, experience, and location. We believe in rewarding top talent with pay that reflects your value.
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Holiday pay
* Referral bonus
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401K with employer match
* Excellent work/life balance
* Employee Discount & Free Rental Equipment Program
* Opportunity for internal growth and employee advancement

**Basic Function:** The ERP Business Analyst - Microsoft D365 Business Central drives the development and optimization of manufacturing-focused digital initiatives through manufacturing execution systems (MES), enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, and analytical capabilities to support operational excellence and future growth in the manufacturing sector. This role is pivotal in aligning key business objectives with core technological capabilities, ensuring seamless integration of manufacturing processes with business systems. The analyst actively gathers business requirements, establishes daily operational processes, and coordinates with internal and external stakeholders to achieve tactical and strategic technological and reporting goals.

**Essential Functions:**

* Maintains a wide variety of tasks within the company’s ERP and MES systems, including setup/configuration, production data uploads, supplier and customer entries, equipment maintenance schedules, shop floor data integration, and system updates.
* Supports critical data and reporting initiatives for daily operations, such as production efficiency, quality control metrics, inventory management, and supply chain optimization.
* Analyzes processes and applications to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of daily operations, coordinating with management approval to deploy updates to technical support and production workflows.
* Acts as a key resource in the implementation of manufacturing-related business processes and information systems; assists with maintaining project timelines; conducts/coordinates system testing, end-user training for shop floor and administrative staff, and post-project reviews to address issues.
* Proactively engages with manufacturing teams to understand operational processes by performing ongoing communication and training with shop floor workers, supervisors, and managerial staff, utilizing standard business analysis techniques tailored to manufacturing environments.
* Mediates accountabilities between manufacturing functions or cross-functional teams to resolve disagreements or data integrity issues, ensuring accurate production and inventory data.
* Prepares training materials as needed to conduct and facilitate training to increase awareness and drive the smooth adoption of technology.
* Assists in defining and documenting processes, templates, and technical specifications.
* Coordinates with stakeholders to ensure data requirements are an accurate representation of business need to execute master data maintenance activities.
* Stays abreast of innovative technologies and processes that pertain to the needs of GNE by attending training sessions, webinars, vendor events, reading technical literature, and networking with peers.
* Keeps supervisor informed of important developments, potential problems, and all related information necessary for effective management.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
* Attends training as directed by GNE.

**Secondary Functions:**

* Support and assist with all other ERP daily operations and activities including sales, customer accounts, distribution, reporting, and data uploads.
* Assist with other departmental projects as needed.

**Qualifications and Experience:**

*Required*

* A minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role in a manufacturing environment, with a focus on implementing and supporting Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience with Microsoft Dynamics Business Central.
* Demonstrated experience in managing cross-functional projects, including system implementations, process improvements, and stakeholder coordination in a manufacturing setting.
* Ability to research, plan, organize, lead, and implement new processes or technology.
* Able to articulate business requirements and communicate with a wide variety of resources.
* Intermediate knowledge and skills in MS Office products-Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

*Preferred*

* Bachelor’s degree.
* Experience with two step distribution/dealer network.
* Vendor relations experience.

**Travel**

* Local travel is required.

title: Business Systems Analyst II - Artificial Intelligence (AI)
description:
Overview:

Gray Construction is looking to add a Business Systems Analyst II with a background in Artificial Intelligence solutions to be based in our Lexington, KY office.

:

**Why Gray?**

Gray is a fully integrated, global service provider deeply rooted in engineering, design, and construction, along with smart manufacturing and equipment manufacturing services. Consistently ranked as a leader in the industry, we focus on the following markets for domestic and international customers: Food & Beverage, Manufacturing, Data Centers, Distribution, and Advanced Technology.

Founded in 1960, Gray’s robust offering enables us to create one-of-a-kind solutions at the highest levels of customization, delivering unmatched precision and partnership to some of the world’s most sophisticated organizations. Still, these areas don’t define Gray—our people do. Passion, commitment, and a great team spirit all speak to the team members at Gray.

**Who we want… (Requirements)**

* BS/BA in Computer Science, Business, Project Management, Finance, Accounting, Marketing, Sales, or related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Minimum 3 years business systems analyst experience
* Technical project management and team coordination experience

* Demonstrates a curious interest in exploring the latest advancements in AI technology.
* Actively seeks opportunities, within Gray, to implement AI concepts and applications.
* Shows enthusiasm for experimenting with AI tools and techniques to solve complex problems.
* Exhibits a proactive approach to staying updated with AI trends and innovations.
* Passionate about contributing to AI projects and collaborating with others in the field.
* Proven ability to manage ambiguity and a diverse portfolio of projects
* Work with key stakeholders to strategically prioritize projects that align with business objectives.

* Technically savvy with an understanding of database concepts, functional AI setups, cybersecurity, and business processes
* Strong people skills: ability to interact and collaborate with all levels across the organization.
* Excellent in writing effective documentation including but not limited to requirements, process flow maps, and use cases
* Effective change management skills, analytical skills & process orientation
* Previous experience training end-users in the use of applications and processes

The new team member should be an energetic, self-motivated individual who enjoys a team environment, as well as a passion for collaboration and professional development. If you are a high achiever striving to exceed expectations in a fast-paced innovative company, then Gray is the place for you.

The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  
:

**What we expect… (Essential Functions)**

This individual serves as an ambassador by helping internal customers manage the system(s) and assists with the current processes and data analysis. The individual will work with other business systems analysts and the supported team to improve system(s) use and business operations. This team member works closely with the team to interpret the data and develop solutions and processes that provide value for the business.

  

* Detailed understanding of AI solutions and other intelligent vendor offerings.
* Fosters a working relationship with vendor(s) and works with vendor system support to resolve questions and issues
* Experience with AI readiness, literacy, GenAI, AI ethics, risk, and security.
* Trains new and existing users of the systems; create/maintain users manuals to support training efforts.
* Ability to oversee and maintain AI solutions, licenses, request processes, and business process improvements for key users.
* Gathers and defines business requirements and process improvements.
* Evaluates, supports, and optimizes the business processes and systems that support AI ambitions, including installation, customization, development, maintenance, security, and upgrades to applications, systems, and modules.
* Collaborates with leadership and the supported team to identify system improvements and enhancements, and requirements; recommend and implement solutions.
* Assists with building dashboards in Business Intelligence environment regarding various operational metrics.
* Ensures system compliance with data security and privacy requirements to protect team member data.
* Researches and participates in the AI community to resolve issues where answers are unknown and implement solutions.
* Maintains knowledge of trends and developments in AI providers, vendors, and technology.
* Performs other duties as required.

**Physical Demands & Work Environment**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this position, the team member is frequently required to stand, walk, sit, use hands, reach with hands or arms and talk or hear. They may occasionally be required to climb or balance, stoop, kneel, or crouch. Must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required include close vision.

Generally, normal office environment where noise level is moderate and temperature/humidity is controlled. Overtime may be required.

**Supervisory Responsibilities**

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

**EEO Disclaimer**

*Gray is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes everyone to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.*
