Non-Exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. Exempt new hires participate in Cisco’s flexible Vacation Time Off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use but is subject to availability and some business limitations. All new hires are eligible for Sick Time Off subject to Cisco’s Sick Time Off Policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on January 1st of each year thereafter. Up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. Employees in Illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. All employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows: .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota; 1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%; 1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.
company_description: Splunk helps make organizations more digitally resilient. Leading organizations use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable.

title: Business Process Analyst - REMOTE
description:
Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.

ROLE:

Cisco Sales Capabilities and Readiness team, part of Cisco’s Sales Strategy and Planning organization, is seeking a Process Engineer to lead the documentation, analysis, and redesign of processes within the domains of sales operations, sales readiness, and sales strategy. This role is critical to helping Cisco optimize its sales performance, drive operational efficiency, and enable our global sales teams to deliver exceptional results.

The ideal candidate is adaptable, highly analytical, detail-oriented, and adept at identifying inefficiencies and communicating opportunities for improvement. This individual will work cross-functionally with stakeholders in sales, operations, finance, enablement, and leadership to design and implement scalable, streamlined processes that align with Cisco’s growth and efficiency objectives.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Process Documentation

* Conduct deep-dive assessments of existing sales operations and planning processes, documenting workflows, interdependencies, and improvement opportunities.
* Develop clear, detailed process maps using digital collaboration tools to visually represent complete workflows (including people, platform, policy, and data dependencies).
* Maintain an up-to-date repository of process documentation to ensure alignment across teams and functions.
* Create future workflows and document related business requirements for improvement realization.

Process Analysis and Optimization

* Collaborate with stakeholders to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and areas for improvement within sales processes.
* Perform root cause analysis to uncover the underlying issues affecting performance and productivity.
* Use data-driven insights and industry best practices to recommend streamlined, scalable solutions related to process, policy, data, or people.

Process Redesign and Implementation

* Lead the design of future-state processes that are aligned with Cisco’s sales objectives and operational strategies.
* Develop and implement new frameworks and methodologies for sales operations, readiness, and strategy processes.
* Partner with business capabilities managers, IT, sales enablement, and other cross-functional teams to ensure successful implementation of redesigned processes.

Change Management and Training

* Act as a change agent to drive adoption of new processes and methodologies across the organization.
* Develop training materials and deliver workshops to educate stakeholders on process changes and best practices.
* Track adoption metrics and collect stakeholder feedback to refine and optimize new processes.

Performance Measurement and Continuous Improvement

* Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of sales processes.
* Establish a framework for continuous improvement by regularly reviewing processes and incorporating stakeholder feedback.
* Stay informed about emerging industry trends and tools to ensure Cisco’s processes remain best-in-class.

REQUIREMENTS:

* Strong knowledge of process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Kaizen.
* Knowledge and experience with a process modelling notation.
* Expertise in process mapping and modelling tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart, Miro).
* Analytical mindset with the ability to identify areas of improvement, interdependencies, and make evidence-based recommendations.
* Familiarity with sales operations tools/platforms, processes, policies and data.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering results in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize effectively.
* Bachelor’s degree in business administration or management, operations management, or a related field.
* Certification in a process improvement framework. Preferred

Pay Salary Range: $110,400 - $139,500

description:

Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.

ROLE:

Cisco Systems is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to play a key role in the development of a robust Customer Segmentation Model. This individual will work cross-functionally with teams in data analytics, marketing, sales, and technology to document, analyze, and manage requirements that directly impact Cisco’s customer engagement strategies. The ideal candidate will bring strong analytical skills, a foundation in data analytics, attention to detail, and an ability to translate analytical or data-centric business needs into clear business requirement, ensuring alignment with Cisco’s overarching business objectives.

This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to high-visibility projects with the potential to transform the way Cisco understands and interacts with its customers globally to deliver growth at an efficient cost-to-serve.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Requirement Analysis and Documentation

* Collaborate with key stakeholders, including business units, marketing, sales, and technical teams, to gather, analyze, and document business requirements for the customer segmentation model.
* Develop detailed requirement artifacts, such as Business Requirement Documents (BRD), Functional Specifications, and User Stories.
* Define clear acceptance criteria and ensure alignment with business goals and technical feasibility.

Data Analysis and Customer Insights

* Perform foundational data analytics tasks; sourcing, manipulating, and visualising data for analysis to quantify business problem statements and explore business requirements.
* Partner with data scientists and analysts to interpret existing customer data and identify patterns and trends that inform segmentation strategies.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define the segmentation criteria (e.g., demographics, purchasing behavior, geographic regions, etc.) and ensure alignment with business outcomes.

Stakeholder Collaboration

* Facilitate workshops, interviews, and focus groups to elicit requirements and validate the proposed segmentation model.
* Act as a liaison between business units and technical teams, ensuring seamless communication and understanding of the project’s objectives.

Model Development and Testing

* Work closely with data science and engineering teams to ensure that the segmentation model meets business requirements, is scalable, and adheres to best practices.
* Support testing phases, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT), by validating outputs against the defined requirements and acceptance criteria.
* Recommend refinements and adjustments to the model based on stakeholder feedback and testing results.

Change Management and Documentation

* Develop and maintain documentation, including process flows, use cases, and training materials, to support the adoption of the customer segmentation model across the organization.
* Collaborate with change management teams to ensure smooth implementation and onboarding for key users.

Performance Monitoring and Reporting

* Define KPIs and success metrics for the segmentation model in collaboration with business stakeholders.
* Monitor the model’s performance post-implementation and provide regular updates to leadership, including actionable recommendations for ongoing improvements.

REQUIREMENTS:

  

* 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in data analytics, customer insights, or marketing projects.
* Proven experience in gathering, analyzing, and documenting requirements for analytics or data-driven projects.
* Prior experience working on customer segmentation, customer insights, or predictive analytics initiatives is highly desirable.

Technical Skills

* Strong foundation of data analytics, machine learning models, and statistical techniques.
* Basic proficiency in SQL or other query languages is a plus.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
* Proficiency in business process modelling and requirements management tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Visio, etc.).

Soft Skills

* Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with a collaborative mindset and ability to influence cross-functional teams.
* High degree of adaptability and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Preferred Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master’s degree is a plus.

Pay Salary Range: $110400 - 139500

* Act as a liaison between business units and technical teams, ensuring seamless communication and understanding of the project’s objectives.

Model Development and Testing

* Work closely with data science and engineering teams to ensure that the segmentation model meets business requirements, is scalable, and adheres to best practices.
* Support testing phases, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT), by validating outputs against the defined requirements and acceptance criteria.
* Recommend refinements and adjustments to the model based on stakeholder feedback and testing results.

Change Management and Documentation

* Develop and maintain documentation, including process flows, use cases, and training materials, to support the adoption of the customer segmentation model across the organization.
* Collaborate with change management teams to ensure smooth implementation and onboarding for key users.

Performance Monitoring and Reporting

* Define KPIs and success metrics for the segmentation model in collaboration with business stakeholders.
* Monitor the model’s performance post-implementation and provide regular updates to leadership, including actionable recommendations for ongoing improvements.

REQUIREMENTS:

  

* 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in data analytics, customer insights, or marketing projects.
* Proven experience in gathering, analyzing, and documenting requirements for analytics or data-driven projects.
* Prior experience working on customer segmentation, customer insights, or predictive analytics initiatives is highly desirable.

Technical Skills

* Strong foundation of data analytics, machine learning models, and statistical techniques.
* Basic proficiency in SQL or other query languages is a plus.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
* Proficiency in business process modelling and requirements management tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Visio, etc.).

Soft Skills

* Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with a collaborative mindset and ability to influence cross-functional teams.
* High degree of adaptability and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Preferred Qualifications

* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Data Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master’s degree is a plus.

Pay Salary Range: $110400 - 139500

Cisco, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long -term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings.

Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday (for non-exempt employees), plus a day off for their birthday. Non-Exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. Exempt new hires participate in Cisco’s flexible Vacation Time Off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use but is subject to availability and some business limitations. All new hires are eligible for Sick Time Off subject to Cisco’s Sick Time Off Policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on January 1st of each year thereafter. Up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. Employees in Illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. All employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows: .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota; 1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%; 1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

title: Business Process Analyst - REMOTE
description:
Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.

ROLE:

Cisco Sales Capabilities and Readiness team, part of Cisco’s Sales Strategy and Planning organization, is seeking a Process Engineer to lead the documentation, analysis, and redesign of processes within the domains of sales operations, sales readiness, and sales strategy. This role is critical to helping Cisco optimize its sales performance, drive operational efficiency, and enable our global sales teams to deliver exceptional results.

The ideal candidate is adaptable, highly analytical, detail-oriented, and adept at identifying inefficiencies and communicating opportunities for improvement. This individual will work cross-functionally with stakeholders in sales, operations, finance, enablement, and leadership to design and implement scalable, streamlined processes that align with Cisco’s growth and efficiency objectives.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Process Documentation

* Conduct deep-dive assessments of existing sales operations and planning processes, documenting workflows, interdependencies, and improvement opportunities.
* Develop clear, detailed process maps using digital collaboration tools to visually represent complete workflows (including people, platform, policy, and data dependencies).
* Maintain an up-to-date repository of process documentation to ensure alignment across teams and functions.
* Create future workflows and document related business requirements for improvement realization.

Process Analysis and Optimization

* Collaborate with stakeholders to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and areas for improvement within sales processes.
* Perform root cause analysis to uncover the underlying issues affecting performance and productivity.
* Use data-driven insights and industry best practices to recommend streamlined, scalable solutions related to process, policy, data, or people.

Process Redesign and Implementation

* Lead the design of future-state processes that are aligned with Cisco’s sales objectives and operational strategies.
* Develop and implement new frameworks and methodologies for sales operations, readiness, and strategy processes.
* Partner with business capabilities managers, IT, sales enablement, and other cross-functional teams to ensure successful implementation of redesigned processes.

Change Management and Training

* Act as a change agent to drive adoption of new processes and methodologies across the organization.
* Develop training materials and deliver workshops to educate stakeholders on process changes and best practices.
* Track adoption metrics and collect stakeholder feedback to refine and optimize new processes.

Performance Measurement and Continuous Improvement

* Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of sales processes.
* Establish a framework for continuous improvement by regularly reviewing processes and incorporating stakeholder feedback.
* Stay informed about emerging industry trends and tools to ensure Cisco’s processes remain best-in-class.

REQUIREMENTS:

* Strong knowledge of process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, or Kaizen.
* Knowledge and experience with a process modelling notation.
* Expertise in process mapping and modelling tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart, Miro).
* Analytical mindset with the ability to identify areas of improvement, interdependencies, and make evidence-based recommendations.
* Familiarity with sales operations tools/platforms, processes, policies and data.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering results in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize effectively.
* Bachelor’s degree in business administration or management, operations management, or a related field.
* Certification in a process improvement framework. Preferred

Pay Salary Range: $110,400 - $139,500

title: Junior Analyst - Operations & Project Support
description:
We are global private markets specialists delivering tailored investment solutions, advisory services, and impactful, data driven insights to the world's investors. Leveraging the power of our platform and our peerless intelligence across sectors, strategies, and geographies, we help identify the advantages and the answers our clients need to succeed.

**Position Overview:**

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Junior Analyst to support the SPAR Analytics Team. This hybrid role combines project management support, internal communications, and intranet content management, playing a critical role in ensuring smooth operations across strategic initiatives.

Reporting directly to the Head of Operations, the Junior Analyst will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including technology, investment operations, and analytics. The ideal candidate is a proactive self-starter with strong communication skills, a keen interest in financial services, and the ability to manage multiple priorities.

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Project Coordination & Operational Support
  + Assist the Head of Operations in coordinating internal projects across the Analytics Group, including scheduling, documentation, and progress tracking.
  + Monitor project timelines and deliverables using tools such as JIRA and Microsoft Excel.
  + Update Power Point decks and assist with metrics reporting and dashboards, including KPI reporting.
* Internal Intranet Content Management
  + Maintain and update the Analytics Group's intranet pages in SharePoint.
  + Post internal updates, policies, and reporting dashboards to ensure information is current and accessible.
  + Partner with team leads to gather and publish news, announcements, and training materials.
* Communication & Reporting
  + Support the development of internal communications, including newsletters, project updates, and executive summaries.
  + Compile data from various internal systems for reporting and dashboard creation.

**Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in business, Finance, Economics, Communications, or related field.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

**Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Exposure to asset management, investment operations, or analytics teams.
* Experience with project management tools
* Basic understanding of business analytics and reporting concepts.

Salary: $25 / hour

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Job Overview**

We are seeking a detail-oriented and technically proficient **Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst/Developer** to join our team. This role will be responsible for designing and developing databases, generating reports and dashboards, and gathering and documenting business requirements. The ideal candidate will work closely with stakeholders to transform data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Database Development & Management**
* + Design, build, and maintain data models, data warehouses, and ETL processes.
  + Optimize database performance and ensure data quality and integrity.
  + Integrate data from various sources (e.g., ERP, CRM, external APIs) into centralized systems.
* **Reporting & Data Visualization**
* + Develop, automate, and maintain dashboards and reports using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
  + Ensure reports are accurate, user-friendly, and aligned with business goals.
  + Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and deliver insights to support business performance.
* **Requirements Gathering & Documentation**
* + Work with business to understand their analytical and reporting needs.
  + Translate business needs into technical specifications and BI requirements documents.
  + Develop user guides, data dictionaries, and documentation for BI solutions.
* **Collaboration & Communication**
* + Liaise between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure BI solutions meet user requirements.
  + Provide training and support for users on BI tools and dashboards.
  + Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging BI technologies.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in BI development, data analysis, or a similar role.
* Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL).
* Hands-on experience with BI/reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
* Experience with R365, Toast, Resy is a plus

title: Business Data Analyst - McAllen, TX
description:
**Position Summary**

The Business Data Analyst is responsible for providing support to the Loan Reconciliation and Data Support Specialist and Loan Servicing Specialists while effectively communicating with management to ensure all loans are processed and serviced according to Bank’s policies and procedures. Works closely with Information Technology regarding the loan specification system as well as assist in performing general ledger reporting and reconciliation as required by FDICIA guidelines. Will assist the Senior Operations Officer in identifying opportunities, creating efficiencies within the loan servicing process. The Officer will assist in ensuring team meets all departmental goals for productivity, quality, and efficiency; remain up-to-date and knowledgeable on all company policies and procedures relative to the Bank’s loan portfolio; and provides assistance and support to the lending staff. Will ensure quality work, superior customer service and assist with daily operations of the Loan Administration Department, as needed.

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**

* Works to develop and increase skill set and knowledge of all loan servicing specialists.

* Ensures reports, tickets, etc. accurately reflect compliance with federal and state regulatory requirements as well as general bank financial reporting requirements.

* Responsible for the monthly review and accuracy of Non-Accrual, Charge-Off and Loan Recovery transactions and Escrow balances.

* Recommends and implements operational and process efficiencies to improve the employee experience, reduce workload impact and provide consistent, correct results.

* Responsible for management and reporting of required reports.

* Creates and submits reports to management, departments and appropriate committees as required.

* Supports the GL Reconciliation Specialist in ensuring general ledger reporting and balancing are performed timely and correctly.

**Other Responsibilities**

* Strong understanding of loan administration and servicing as well as the ancillary software used throughout the department.
* Ability to meet deadlines under pressure.
* Support and promote the Bank vision, mission and core values, organizational structure, policies, and procedures.
* Must have excellent analysis, observation and decision-making skills.
* Highly focused, able to rapidly determine key priorities, clearly communicate the priorities and ensure resources are properly aligned.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are necessary for maintaining effective relationships with officers and employees.
* Individual should be able to work under high pressure situations and a stressful atmosphere and then should remain composed.
* Attends and participates in meetings and committees as required.
* Provides strong, compassionate and visible teamwork, which fosters positive attitudes, collaboration and trust among management and employees.
* Complies with all federal and state laws, and all established bank policies and procedures.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Education and Experience Requirements**

* A self-starting team player who possesses a High School Diploma or GED.
* 5 years or more of banking experience with a minimum of 3 years in loan administration (preferred).
* PC literate and knowledge of spreadsheet and word processing software are **required.**
* Attention to detail and a high degree of mental concentration are required, as well as the ability to multi-task.
* Knowledgeable in loan compliance and regulations.
* Texas Regional Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Business & Operations Support Analyst
description:
Delta Dental of Kentucky is looking for a dynamic individual to fill the role of Business & Operations Support Analyst in our Louisville, Kentucky office.

**Job Summary**

This department is responsible for the business side of DDKY’s enterprise system provided on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) basis by SKYGEN, a technology platform for insurance benefits encompassing client set-up and billing, benefit eligibility, claims processing, customer service, provider network data, broker/producer payment, and the data warehouse.

This position is responsible for production support, documentation, testing, and configuration of the system; assisting with business analyst functions such as needs assessment, planning, analysis, and implementation; supporting requests for new functionality; aiding in vendor communication; monitoring system processes.

**Responsibilities**

* Participate in implementing SKYGEN Enterprise System (ES) quarterly releases, including coordination and/or execution of preliminary and detailed impact analysis of all system changes with business owners and IT
* Assist in system configuration and coordinating mass updates and change requirements
* Assist with development of data/test scripts used for automated and manual testing scenarios for use in facilitation/execution of smoke testing, regression testing, and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) of ES releases
* Triage and report issues found during release testing and ensure readiness for production
* Triage work orders and change requests to determine necessary department specific system enhancements
* Participate in organization-level strategic initiatives as well as operating system process-based initiatives
* Facilitate custom solution delivery through regression tests, establishing plan for enhancement delivery and implementation
* Further analyze system functionality and identify/recommend enhancements and/or process changes to accommodate future operational and product needs
* Interact with process owners, business owners, and system users to translate business requirements into technical specifications
* Facilitate updates to ES to accommodate required corporate policy and regulatory/global changes
* Assist with troubleshooting and tracking of reported production support issues, including development, testing, and implementation of solutions
* Provide defect management and coordinate deployment of solutions with ES vendor and internal resources
* Manage inventory of business process workflows, training catalogs, custom functionality, and test cases
* Proactively anticipate problems and provide alternatives as needed
* Establish a rapport with the internal business unit leaders and foster on-going communication regarding business needs to develop proactive solutions
* Perform other related assigned duties as necessary to complete the Primary Job Responsibilities as described above.

**Minimum Qualifications**

Position requires a bachelor’s degree in business or an equivalent technical institute degree or significant or relevant on-the-job experience in lieu of degree. The preferred candidate will have a background in business analysis, quality assurance testing and 3 or more years of experience in insurance or healthcare. Will accept any suitable combination of education, training, or experience.

Position requires the ability to work with business units to analyze, document, and make recommendations on process improvements; ability to map functional requirements for ES to vendor and internal system modifications; strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to make timely and sound decisions; excellent verbal and written communications, presentation, and effective listening skills; strong meeting facilitation and communication skills working across all levels of the organization; ability to manage competing priorities in a complex environment.

Position also requires proficiency in technology applications and tools, specifically Microsoft Office skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote) and hosting online meetings with tools such as WebEx, GoToMeeting, Teams or Zoom. Infrequent overnight travel may be required.

*Delta Dental of Kentucky, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or veteran status.*

title: Management Analyst (Business Analysis, Senior Analyst)
description:
Clearance Required:

**Secret**

Education Required:

**BA/BS**

US Citizenship:

**Required**

**Summary**

**The MIL Corporation** seeks a **Management Analyst, Senior Analyst** (**Business Analysis, Sr Analyst)** to support a federal government client in the Arlington VA area. The role functions as an expert on management systems, techniques, processes, and technology that will optimize the Division's operations. The role engages in analysis of administrative processes and/or Division programs, making recommendations for programs, policies, and activities. Specific processes may vary depending upon the directorate and/or office assigned, with activities, workflows, and systems/tools governed by SOPs that typically evolve over time.

This position currently requires a hybrid schedule, with 3 days on-site per week, but may vary based on client requirements. Schedule is subject to change based on company/contract requirements. Remote work is not authorized for this position.

**Responsibilities**

* Support the preparation of recurring reports and write documentation with recommendations for management programs, policies, and activities.
* Conduct qualitative and quantitative research and perform analyses on a broad range of topics contributing to various bureau initiatives.
* Formulate recommendations for resolution strategies for identified deficiencies or potential problems and collaborate with Resource Manager to obtain the proper approvals for implementation.
* Engage in evaluating administrative processes and programs and developing related resource requests to enhance strategic and performance efforts.
* Support various aspects of contract administration, including preparing contract materials, monitoring compliance and performance, tracking deliverables and invoices, analyzing vouchers, invoices, claims, and other requests for payment for accuracy, adequacy of documentation and correct contractual references, and maintaining files consistent with applicable federal and agency regulations.
* Coordinate and monitor short-term and long-term projects and taskers that will involve stakeholders in other directorates/programs and/or DS personnel.

**Travel**

Travel up to 25% may be required but is not expected on a regular basis.

**Required Qualifications**

* 5-7 years of experience with management analysis, strategy, resource management and/or contract management.
* Must be highly organized and have excellent oral and written communication skills to interface with client personnel, other government agencies, and vendors at all levels.
* Must demonstrate proficiency in the use of Microsoft applications (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel).
* Maintains professional competence and specialized knowledge base by keeping abreast of emerging themes and best practices.
* Knowledge of and skill in applying analytical and evaluate techniques to plan, schedule and conduct studies and analyses of management functions or programs.
* General knowledge of appropriations law, FAR, FTR, and the application of various laws, regulations, and policies related to the programs and associated support services.
* Must be a US Citizen.

**Desired Qualifications**

* Demonstrate a thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including PowerApps, Power Automate, SharePoint, and Office 365.
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent research and briefing skills.
* CGFM or other relevant professional certifications.

**Education**

BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting or other relevant Business Field.

**Clearance**

Secret with eligibility to obtain and maintain a Top Secret security clearance; employment is contingent on passing the government clearance process.

**Compensation**

The MIL Corporation values your contributions and offers a range of benefits to support your overall well-being. We are pleased to offer a comprehensive range of benefits to our full-time employees which includes health, life, disability, and retirement plans, as well as paid time off, opportunities for professional growth and tuition assistance. Additional benefits and incentives may also apply, which will be communicated during the hiring process.

Salary at MIL is determined based on factors such as qualifications, experience, and contractual limitations. For this position, the projected compensation range is $80,000 - $110,000 per year. This estimate represents the typical salary range and is just one part of MIL’s complete compensation package.

**Why MIL?**

The MIL Corporation (MIL) is a dynamic workforce of industry professionals who deliver world-class solutions in cyber, engineering, financial management, and information technology – and we are looking for candidates like you! Whether you’re fresh out of college, the military, or well into your professional services career, MIL has great job opportunities that might be a great fit.

Here at MIL, we pride ourselves on the family-like environment instilled amongst our team. Our employees love working here, and it truly shows through our various recognitions & awards. Some of our most recent awards include:

* 2021-2024, Top Workplaces USA award (Energage)
* 2017-2024 Top Workplaces Award, Greater Washington Area (The Washington Post)
* 2018-2025 Certified Great Workplace, Great Place to Work®

  + 2021 - 2024, Best Workplaces in Consulting & Professional Services™
  + 2021 Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials™
  + 2018 Fortune, Great Place to Work: Best Place to Work for Diversity
* 2020- 2024, 2017, Top Workplace Award, South Carolina (Greenville Business Magazine, Columbia Business Monthly, and Charleston Business Magazine)
* 2024 Patriot Award, Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR), Department of Defense
* 2022 Freedom Award, Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR), Department of Defense
* 2018, Above & Beyond Award, Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR), Department of Defense

If your goal is to help the federal government deploy leading technologies, improve financial management, or defend the nation in cyberspace, MIL welcomes you. Become a part of something greater, where you, the people, make the difference.

**Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law.**

title: Strategy & Operations Analyst – AI Tools & Automation
description:
CSC Generation (CSC) is an AI-enabled multi-brand platform that acquires and transforms retailers into profitable, digital-first, consumer-centric businesses. CSC owns and operates more than 10 retail, eCommerce, and wholesale companies, including Sur La Table, One Kings Lane, and Backcountry.

We are hiring a **Strategy & Operations Analyst – AI Tools & Automation** to support one of CSC’s brand CEOs in driving key operational and AI initiatives. This role blends AI product thinking, business intelligence, and project execution—and is ideal for someone early in their career who is both highly analytical and deeply curious.

This is a demanding role. But for the right person—driven, sharp, and eager to learn—there is no ceiling to how quickly you can grow within the organization. You'll work directly with top executives, tackle real business challenges, and build a deep foundation in strategy, operations, and AI product work.

This position will report into the CEO of a CSC Generation brand.

### **What you get to do every day:**

* Partner with the CEO to operationalize strategy and accelerate key priorities.
* Build lightweight, AI-powered internal tools that streamline workflows across functions.
* Create and own project plans, track deliverables, and follow up with stakeholders to ensure execution.
* Analyze trends in sales, marketing, merchandising, and ops to generate actionable insights.
* Use generative AI tools to automate reporting, draft content, and develop workflows.
* Prepare executive updates, dashboards, and internal presentations to guide decision-making.
* Work closely with department leaders to identify repetitive processes and launch automation pilots—replacing manual workflows with scalable, AI-enabled systems.

### **What you bring to the role:**

* Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* 1–3 years of experience in consulting, analytics, bizops, product, or similar high-intensity roles.
* Strong grasp of AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Copilot, etc.) and how to integrate them into daily work.
* Familiarity with automation tools (n8n, Zapier, Make.com) and experience designing lightweight workflows.
* Advanced Excel or Sheets skills; SQL, Python, or data visualization a plus.
* Fast learner with strong initiative, accountability, and follow-through.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and confident in navigating ambiguity.
* Hunger to grow fast, solve big problems, and learn directly from C-level leaders.

### **What’s in it for you? Joining CSC Generation isn’t just about having a seat at the table—it’s about helping redesign the table entirely. You’ll be challenged, stretched, and supported as you grow faster than you thought possible. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer:**

* **Executive Access:** Work directly with brand CEOs and senior leadership, solving real business problems and earning mentorship from top operators.
* **AI-First Skill Building:**Get hands-on with the most advanced AI tools in the market. From automation to prompt engineering, you’ll build a modern tech stack that sets you apart in any industry.
* **Accelerated Career Path:**High performers are quickly entrusted with greater responsibility, new challenges, and leadership opportunities across our portfolio of brands.
* **Competitive benefits:**Paid time off policies, 401(k)/RRSP match, medical/dental/vision and a variety of supplemental policies, and employee discounts at our portfolio companies

### **What our interview process looks like:**

* \\uD83D\\uDCDE **Step 1:** If you align with our vision and meet the qualifications, we’ll reach out to schedule a conversation and introduce CSC.
* \\uD83E\\uDDE0 **Step 2:**You’ll complete a short AI or product-building challenge so we can understand how you approach problems and execution.
* \\uD83D\\uDCAC **Step 3:**Participate in deep-dive interviews with CSC leadership focused on your experience, product mindset, and operational thinking.
* \\uD83D\\uDCE9 **Step 4:** Offer. We’ll move fast for the right candidate.

For US-based candidates, this posting is intended for candidates that reside in the following states:

AZ, DE, FL, GA, IN, LA, MI, MS, MO, NV, NC, OK, OR, PA, TN, TX, UT, VA, WV, WI, and WY.

Our preference is for candidates who reside near our hubs in Northwest Indiana, Austin, Texas, and Toronto, Ontario.

Washington state applicants only: If you believe that this job posting does not comply with applicable Washington state law, please notify us by sending an email toWACandidates@cscshared.com.

The CSC Generation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, state or local laws.

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie-detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

The CSC family of brands is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact hrbenefits@cscshared.com.

title: Business Analysis, Associate
description:
Clearance Required:

**Secret**

Education Required:

**BA/BS**

US Citizenship:

**Required**

**Summary**

**The MIL Corporation** seeks a **Business Analysis, Associate** to support a Federal Government client at our McLean, Virginia location.

This position currently requires a fully on-site schedule. Schedule is subject to change based on company/contract requirements.

**Responsibilities**

* Assist in managing the Unliquidated Obligations for the client
* Review invoices for COR approval
* Assist in the reconciliation process for the DS/EX/CFO Program Office
* Assist with reporting/briefings on Unliquidated Obligations
* Coordinate with third party vendors in regards to ULO balances
* Create memos for MIPR's and Third Party Vendor obligations
* Provide Support in entering Purchase Requests for new funding and modifications to contracts
* Coordinate domestic and international travel authorizations for personnel.
* Provide office management assistance

**Travel**

None

**Required Qualifications**

* 7 years of relevant professional experience
* Experience in travel coordination
* Expert skill in Microsoft Excel
* Reconciliation experience
* Knowledge of government obligations and spending
* Knowledge of Unliquidated Obligation balances
* Very good analytical and multi-tasking skills
* Ability to be flexible in a demanding work environment
* Ability to work independently and as a team member
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent customer service skills

**Desired Qualifications**

* Momentum Experience
* Invoice Experience
* Contracts Experience
* Experience in office management

**Education**

BA/BS or relevant experience

**Clearance**

All applicants for this position must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance; please note that the clearance process takes into account financial background aspects

**Compensation**

The MIL Corporation values your contributions and offers a range of benefits to support your overall well-being. We are pleased to offer a comprehensive range of benefits to our full-time employees which include health, life, disability, and retirement plans, as well as paid time off, opportunities for professional growth and tuition assistance. Additional benefits and incentives may also apply, which will be communicated during the hiring process.

For this position, the projected compensation range is $120,000 - $136,000 per year. This estimate represents the typical salary range and is just one part of MIL’s complete compensation package. Final salary for this position is determined based on factors such as individual qualifications, education, experience, and contractual limitations. Learn more on the MIL Careers page.

**Why MIL?**

The MIL Corporation (MIL) is a dynamic workforce of industry professionals who deliver world-class solutions in cyber, engineering, financial management, and information technology – and we are looking for candidates like you! Whether you’re fresh out of college, the military, or well into your professional services career, MIL has great job opportunities that might be a great fit.

Here at MIL, we pride ourselves on the family-like environment instilled amongst our team. Our employees love working here, and it truly shows through our various recognitions & awards. Some of our most recent awards include:

* 2021-2024, Top Workplaces USA award (Energage)
* 2017-2024 Top Workplaces Award, Greater Washington Area (The Washington Post)
* 2018-2025 Certified Great Workplace, Great Place to Work®

  + 2021 - 2024, Best Workplaces in Consulting & Professional Services™
  + 2021 Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials™
  + 2018 Fortune, Great Place to Work: Best Place to Work for Diversity
* 2020- 2024, 2017, Top Workplace Award, South Carolina (Greenville Business Magazine, Columbia Business Monthly, and Charleston Business Magazine)
* 2024 Patriot Award, Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR), Department of Defense
* 2022 Freedom Award, Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR), Department of Defense
* 2018, Above & Beyond Award, Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve (ESGR), Department of Defense

If your goal is to help the federal government deploy leading technologies, improve financial management, or defend the nation in cyberspace, MIL welcomes you. Become a part of something greater, where you, the people, make the difference.

**Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law.**

title: Sales Support Claims Analyst
description:
**You may not know our name, but you know our products. What we make is part the places where we live, work and play – all day, everyday.**

Zekelman is a family of companies — 100% domestic manufacturers — with a legacy dating back to 1877. We’re proud to be the largest independent steel pipe and tube manufacturer in North America and the leading innovator in multi-family housing development.

**We believe in what we build and what we build, builds the world around us. Hospitals, hotels, schools, bridges, airports and more.**

**Come build a career you believe in.**

**JOB SUMMARY**

As a Sales Support & Claims Analyst, you will play a key role in improving customer satisfaction through accurate and timely support. This position will support the sales department by streamlining operations, managing customer accounts and ensuring efficient processing of orders, claims and returns.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Leads and promotes healthy and safe work practices as required by regulatory agencies and Company policy
* Assists the inside sales team with order processing, pricing inquiries and customer account management
* Monitors order fulfillment status and proactively resolves delays and discrepancies
* Processes customer claims and returns timely and accurately in compliance with company policies
* Investigates the root cause of claims and collaborates with internal teams to resolve them
* Communicates professionally with customers regarding claim status and resolution
* Tracks and analyzes return trends to recommend process improvements
* Generates and publishes monthly claims and returns reports
* Supports process audits and ensure data integrity across claims and returns system
* Collaborates with cross-functional teams to support initiatives that enhance customer satisfaction and operational efficiency
* Some travel may be required (<5%)
* Performs other duties as they might be assigned
* Regular, full-time predictable onsite attendance is an essential function of this role

**EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent education/experience
* Previous customer service or sales experience desired
* Knowledge of SAP is preferred

**KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS / COMPETENCIES**

* Good written and verbal communication skills
* Leadership, planning, management, and motivational skills
* Analytical, observational, and troubleshooting skills
* Computer and reporting skills

The compensation for this role is $28 - 39.67/hr

Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including low-cost, high-quality medical and dental benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program, a bonus plan, a 401(k) plan with a generous company match, immediate vesting, and much more.

M/F/D/V

We are Zekelman Industries.

We manufacture superior quality tubular and related products, and provide outstanding service for our valued customers.

We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value of Zekelman Industries and of our customers.

title: PLADS Business Analyst
description:
The Company: Aflac Columbus

The Location:
Remote, US, 31999

The Division: PLADS

Job Id: 7851

**Salary Range:** $75,000 - $95,000

**Job Posting End Date:** June 30th 2025

  

**We’ve Got You Under Our Wing**

We are the duck. We develop and empower our people, cultivate relationships, give back to our community, and celebrate every success along the way. We do it all…*The Aflac Way*.

  

Aflac, a Fortune 500 company, is an industry leader in voluntary insurance products that pay cash directly to policyholders and one of America's best-known brands. Aflac has been recognized as Fortune’s 50 Best Workplaces for Diversity and as one of World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere.com.

  

Our business is about being there for people in need. So, ask yourself, are you the duck? If so, there’s a home, and a flourishing career for you at Aflac.

  

**Worker Designation** – This role is designated as a **remote** role. You will be expected to work from your home, within the continental US. Although this role is designated as remote, there may be occasions that you are requested to come to the office based on business need. Any requests to come to the office would be communicated with you in advance.

  

**What does it take to be successful at Aflac?**

* Acting with Integrity

* Communicating Effectively

* Pursuing Self-Development

* Serving Customers

* Supporting Change

* Supporting Organizational Goals

* Working with Diverse Populations

  

**What does it take to be successful in this role?**

* Business Processes

  

* Business Case Preparation

  

* Business Cost Benefit Analysis

  

* Business Definition Requirements

  

* Functional Specification Development

  

* Requirements Definition Development

  

* System Process Flows

  

* Technical Use Case Preparation

  

* Presentation Skills

  

* Technical Requirements Definition

  

* Flowchart Preparation

  

* Data Entity-Relationship (ER) Diagramming

  

* SDLC

  

* Microsoft Office

  

* Visio

  

* Technical Writing

  

* Technical Communication

  

**Education & Experience Required**

* Bachelor's Degree In Computer Science, Business Administration or a related field
* Two or more years of relevant technical work experience that has provided an understanding of organizational systems and capabilities, business operations and requirements, business modeling concepts, software development methodologies, etc.
* Advanced database skills with experience using MS Access, SQL knowledge of how relational databases work.
* Ability to apply statistical and other research methods into systems issues as required; review complex data and derive summary conclusions.
* High value contributor / value added professional.

*Or an equivalent combination of education and experience*

  

**Education & Experience Preferred**

* Experience in the insurance industry – Paid Leave, Disability, and Absence Management

  

**Principal Duties & Responsibilities**

* Performs work for multiple business segments; supports moderate to highly complex business processes.

  

* Serves as a team member for projects of moderate to large scope and moderate to high complexity.

  

* Assists with project deliverables such as project initiation requests, business and technical requirements, use cases, interface specifications, business architecture models, cost/benefit analysis, risk and issue logs, test plans, training plans and elevation / validation plans.

  

* Provides technical solutions to meet user needs, manages business unit expectations and maintains established business relationships.

  

* Communicates and presents moderately complex technical concepts simply and effectively to nontechnical team members Collects, analyzes, and documents business and technical requirements.

  

* Assesses long term needs, performs gap analysis and makes future state recommendations.

  

* Participates in JAD (Joint Application Design) sessions with business partners to enable technical solutions that allow for process improvements.

  

* Owns project deliverables/artifacts, works in a self-directed environment to develop artifacts.

  

* Conducts systems analysis with a focus on technical process models and use cases.

  

* Provides testing support and analysis for defect resolution.

  

* Performs other related duties as required.

  

**Total Rewards**

*This compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. The range has been created in good faith based on information known to Aflac at the time of the posting. Compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. This salary range does not include any potential incentive pay or benefits, however, such information will be provided separately when appropriate. The salary range for this position is $75,000 to $95,000.*

  

*In addition to the base salary, we offer an array of benefits to meet your needs including medical, dental, and vision coverage, prescription drug coverage, health care flexible spending, dependent care flexible spending, Aflac supplemental policies (Accident, Cancer, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity offered at no costs to employee), 401(k) plans, annual bonuses, and an opportunity to purchase company stock. On an annual basis, you’ll also be offered 11 paid holidays, up to 20 days PTO to be used for any reason, and, if eligible, state mandated sick leave (Washington employees accrue 1 hour sick leave for every 40 hours worked) and other leaves of absence, if eligible, when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Aflac complies with all applicable leave laws, including, but not limited to sick and safe leave, and adoption and parental leave, in all states and localities.*

**Nearest Major Market:** Columbus GA

Apply Now »

title: Business Solutions Consult
description:
The Company: Aflac Columbus

The Location:
Remote, US, 31999

The Division: PLADS

Job Id: 7852

**Salary Range:** $80,000 - $100,000

**Job Posting End Date:** June 30th 2025

  

**We’ve Got You Under Our Wing**

We are the duck. We develop and empower our people, cultivate relationships, give back to our community, and celebrate every success along the way. We do it all…*The Aflac Way*.

  

Aflac, a Fortune 500 company, is an industry leader in voluntary insurance products that pay cash directly to policyholders and one of America's best-known brands. Aflac has been recognized as Fortune’s 50 Best Workplaces for Diversity and as one of World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere.com.

  

Our business is about being there for people in need. So, ask yourself, are you the duck? If so, there’s a home, and a flourishing career for you at Aflac.

  

**Worker Designation** – This role is an **onsite** role. You will be required to work at the {INSERT BUILDING NAME HERE} in {INSERT CITY/STATE HERE} during your set working schedule.

  

**Worker Designation** – This role is a **remote** role. This means you will be expected to work from your home, within the continental US. If the role is remote, there may be occasions that you are requested to come to the office based on business need. Any requests to come to the office would be communicated with you in advance.

  

**Worker Designation** – This role is **hybrid**. This means you will be expected to report to one of our Aflac offices located in {INSERT CITY/STATE HERE} for at least 60% of the work week. You will work from your home (within the continental US) for the remaining portion of the work week. Details of this schedule will be discussed with your leadership.

  

**Work Designation.** Depending on your location within the continental US, this role may be **hybrid** or **remote.**

* If you live *within 50 miles* of the Aflac offices located in Columbus, GA or Columbia, SC, this role will be **hybrid.**This means you will be expected to work in the office for at least 60% of the work week. You will work from your home (within the continental US) for the remaining portion of the work week. Details of this schedule will be discussed with your leadership.
* If you live *more than 50 miles* from the Aflac offices located in Columbus, GA or Columbia, SC, this role will be **remote.** This means you will be expected to work from your home, within the continental US. If the role is remote, there may be occasions that you are requested to come to the office based on business need. Any requests to come to the office would be communicated with you in advance.

  

**What does it take to be successful at Aflac?**

* Acting with Integrity

* Communicating Effectively

* Pursuing Self-Development

* Serving Customers

* Supporting Change

* Supporting Organizational Goals

* Working with Diverse Populations

  

**What does it take to be successful in this role?**

* Demonstrated experience in developing projects across all phases of the project life cycle; demonstrated experience in developing functional specifications, process decomposition diagrams, user interface designs, and field level descriptions.

  

* Experience in developing testing processes, scripts, and tracking methods (preferred); experience in working simultaneously with technical IT resources and non-technical business resources and users or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

  

* Working knowledge of the tools, concepts methodologies, and techniques of business process analysis and modeling, such as root cause analysis, cost/benefit analysis, process mapping/simulation, data modeling, problem identification and interpretation, process change management, and performance measures.

  

* A strong understanding of business operations, requirements processes, business modeling concepts, and software development methodologies.

  

* Knowledge of the principles, techniques, and methodology of project management, quality management, and change management.

  

* Excellent presentation, oral, written, and interpersonal communication and team facilitation skills to effectively interact and negotiate with senior management, internal and external customers, and persuade, market, and sell new ideas; ability to synthesize and decide best communication approaches for technical issues and information.

  

* Strong analytical skills to interpret and adapt known methods, system procedures, or operating concepts to new situations.

  

* Ability to adapt to a dynamic, rapidly changing business and technical environment.

  

* Comfort with applying frameworks and problem solving methodologies to unstructured problems.

  

* Ability to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience.

  

* Ability to participate on multiple teams at one time, while maintaining a high level of customer service and focus on commitments.

  

* Ability to document systematic and manual operations procedures in both technical and user friendly language.

  

* Ability to apply statistical and other research methods into systems issues and product as required.

  

* Proven ability to review complex data and derive summary conclusions.

  

* Ability to work efficiently under conditions of multiple deadlines and changing priorities to produce a large volume of high quality material with meticulous attention to detail.

  

**Education & Experience Required**

* Bachelor's Degree In business administration, computer science, or a related field

* 4 or more years of related work experience in a business analyst role performing business analysis, developing business requirements, using analysis techniques, writing technical and/or online documentation for end-users.

* Claims or Leave Absence & Disability experience.

*Or an equivalent combination of education and experience*

  

**Principal Duties & Responsibilities**

* Leads small to medium scale business initiatives/projects; manages one or more projects simultaneously; develops detailed project plans; facilitates development of current and future state process maps that support the process improvement effort; creates and presents recommendations to executive management seeking approval of recommended process improvements; effectively communicate cross-functionally with multiple technical and nontechnical teams; responsible for adapting to change and shifting priorities quickly; coordinates with internal clients to ensure effective communication and awareness on new software/deliverables.

  

* Provides the business and technical project teams with constructive feedback pertaining to project performance; develops and maintains a productive working relationship with business leaders, IT representatives, vendors, and key clients, including providing regular project updates; Provides subject matter expertise in online experience.

  

* Identify and manage risk associated to brand degradation; serves as point of contact for escalated requests, media threats, system outages, regulatory, privacy, legal and compliance issues; communicates impacts to external/internal customers and provide a clear mitigation plan; responsible for ensuring deliverables meet or exceed quality standards (by creating acceptance criteria), increase software performance, improve customer experience, safeguard policyholder information while meeting deadlines; facilitates focus groups and sprint review sessions identify pain points and collect feedback to improve product.

  

* Leads process improvement efforts to define, measure, analyze, and improve processes; plans, organizes, and implements process improvements, including project design, development, and implementation; monitors development and implementation to ensure that projects support departmental goals, meet the needs of the business unit, and are integrated smoothly within time, budget, resource commitment, and standards maintained for all project activities, system implementations, upgrades, and releases.

  

* Evaluates sources of information in order to determine any limitations in terms of reliability or usability; identifies and rationalizes the use of metrics and reports; proactively communicates and collaborates with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements.

  

* Oversees the complete development life cycle (business case development, cost/benefit analysis, project/sprint success measures, user story and acceptance criteria gathering, business process and technical design, product development, testing and implementation), to include creation of associated deliverables from the business perspective; supports other projects and agile teams by providing input on enhancements that have impacts/dependencies to policyholder’s online service tools.

  

* Understands the need for demonstrating cross-functional capabilities amongst the Agile team members; able to identify strengths in team members to gain the most productive deliverables with personal team satisfaction; manage business expectations by keeping executive leadership/stakeholders abreast of progress and potential issues; develops and presents roadmap to align product with corporate vision.

  

* Acts on behalf of executive leadership regarding acceptance criteria, priority of work being delivered, and provides overview of value being delivered through sprints reviews; accountable for project deliverables; understand the technology that supports the applicable business and the limitations/dependencies preventing certain business features from being accomplished; coordinate with to ensure requirements, priorities and decisions are obtained and incorporated into user stories.

  

* Translates strategic vision into technical specifications by creating user stories, acceptance criteria and definition of done; responsible for identifying and releasing minimum viable products (MVP) to deliver value sooner.

  

* Leads teams within the Agile framework to align work priority by creating roadmaps and communication vision; serves as customer proxy through facilitation of sprint planning and backlog refinement sessions by presenting priority items and business case based on the voice of the customer, industry trends, competitor analyses, stakeholder feedback, and enterprise initiatives; allocate agile team members availability for other projects.

  

* Performs other duties as assigned

  

**Total Rewards**

*The salary range for this job is $80,000 to $100,000. This range is specific to the job and salary offers consider a wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including, but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and peer compensation. The range has been created in good faith based on information known to Aflac at the time of the posting.*

  

*At Aflac, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for the role to allow for future and continued salary growth, and compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. This salary range does not include any potential incentive pay or benefits, however, such information will be provided separately when appropriate.*

  

*In addition to the base salary, we offer an array of benefits to meet your needs including medical, dental, and vision coverage, prescription drug coverage, health care flexible spending, dependent care flexible spending, Aflac supplemental policies (Accident, Cancer, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity offered at no costs to employee), 401(k) plans, annual bonuses, and an opportunity to purchase company stock. On an annual basis, you’ll also be offered 11 paid holidays, up to 20 days PTO to be used for any reason, and, if eligible, state-mandated sick leave (Washington employees accrue 1-hour sick leave for every 40 hours worked) and other leaves of absence, if eligible, when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Aflac complies with all applicable leave laws, including, but not limited to, sick and safe leave, and adoption and parental leave, in all states and localities.*

**Nearest Major Market:** Columbus GA

Apply Now »
